Title: Data Analyst - 100% Remote
Description:
We are looking for the very Top Talent‚Ä¶and we would be delighted if you were to join our team!

More in details, UST is a multinational company based in North America, certified as a Top Employer and Great Place to Work company with over 35.000 employees all over the world and presence in more than 35 countries. We are leaders on digital technology services, and we provide large-scale technologic solutions to big companies.




What are we looking for

We are looking for Data Analyst who will contribute to a project with one of our global customers.




Your main responsibilities include:

Lead data model analysis initiatives, especially in the context of a data migration.

Must be able to investigate and propose data mapping solutions to fulfil target data models.

Key player on conversations with data Quality, data Owners and data Stewards, as well as Subject Matter Experts

Must be able to support test cycles to clarify doubts and resolve incidences.

Progress reporting to senior management




What are we looking for?

4yrs working experience as a Data Analyst

Experience in analysis and design of data collection systems.

Track record of developing high quality analysis that has resulted in successful data model definitions and migrations.

Maintains internal and external relationships ensuring compliance in all activities.

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.

What can we offer?

23 days of Annual Leave plus the 24th and 31st of December as discretionary days!
Numerous benefits (Health Care Plan, teleworking compensation, Life and Accident Insurances).
Retribuci√≥n Flexible¬¥ Program: (Meals, Kinder Garden, Transport, online English lessons, Health Care Plan‚Ä¶)
Free access to several training platforms
Professional stability and career plans
UST also, compensates referrals from which you could benefit when you refer professionals.
The option to pick between 12 or 14 payments along the year.
Real Work Life Balance measures (flexibility, WFH or remote work policy, compacted hours during summertime‚Ä¶)
UST Club Platform discounts and gym Access discounts




If you would like to know more, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply and we‚Äôll get in touch to fill you in detail. We are waiting for you!

In UST we are committed to equal opportunities in our selection processes and do not discriminate based on race, gender, disability, age, religion, sexual orientation or nationality.

Title: Data Analyst Power BI
Description:
En Logicalis Spain estamos buscando un perfil de Analista de Datos con fuertes conocimientos en Power BI para unirse a nuestro equipo de an√°lisis de datos donde ser√°s responsable de transformar datos complejos en insights claros y accionables mediante la creaci√≥n y optimizaci√≥n de informes y dashboards en Power BI.




El equipo de Data & Analytics de Logicalis trabaja con clientes nacionales e internacionales, llevando a cabo importantes proyectos de inteligencia artificial y anal√≠tica avanzada, estrategia del dato, gobierno, integraci√≥n y arquitectura, abarcando todo el ciclo de vida del dato.




FUNCIONES

Dise√±ar, desarrollar y mantener informes y dashboards interactivos en Power BI que proporcionen insights clave para diferentes √°reas de la empresa.
Optimizar modelos de datos en Power BI para mejorar el rendimiento y la eficiencia de los informes, asegurando tiempos de respuesta r√°pidos y uso eficiente de recursos.
Crear y mantener medidas y c√°lculos complejos utilizando DAX para proporcionar an√°lisis avanzados y personalizados.
Utilizar Power Query para transformar y preparar datos provenientes de m√∫ltiples fuentes, asegurando que los datos sean precisos y est√©n listos para el an√°lisis.
Crear visualizaciones de datos efectivas y persuasivas que comuniquen insights de manera clara y concisa.
Asegurar que los informes y dashboards est√©n actualizados y reflejen los datos m√°s recientes, implementando actualizaciones y mejoras continuas.




REQUISITOS

M√≠nimo 2 a√±os de experiencia trabajando con Power BI en un entorno profesional.
Experiencia avanzada en Power BI, incluyendo la creaci√≥n de informes y dashboards complejos.
Experiencia en la integraci√≥n de Power BI con otras plataformas y sistemas empresariales.
Dominio de DAX para crear c√°lculos y medidas avanzadas.
S√≥lida experiencia con Power Query para la transformaci√≥n y preparaci√≥n de datos.
Conocimientos en lenguajes de programaci√≥n como SQL, Python, o R.
Valorable certificaciones en Power BI o an√°lisis de datos.




BENEFICIOS

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a talented Junior Data Analyst to help us change the world of digital advertising together!




WHO WE ARE

Seedtag is the leading Contextual Advertising Platform. Our proprietary, machine learning-based technology provides human-like understanding of the content in the web, the highest level of brand safety in the industry and unmatched cookieless targeting capabilities.

We engage with the market on both demand and supply side to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.




KEY FIGURES

2014 ¬∑ Founded by two ex-Googlers

2018 ¬∑ 16M total turnover & Internationalization & Getting growth

2021 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 40M‚Ç¨ & +11 countries & +260 Seedtaggers

2022 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 250M‚Ç¨ + expansion into the U.S market




YOUR CHALLENGE

You will propose new analysis to get the most out of our current data and define what additional data will be needed to improve our current Contextual Understanding
Your data visualization skills will be key to grasp the attention of the public and transmit complex information into simple explanations
You will get full ownership of our contextual data to offer insights and communication strategies to our most relevant clients
You will present your results internally and externally, co-creating contextual strategies with big clients (from Nissan to Coca-Cola, Heineken, Tag Heuer, etc.)
You will help us build contextual tools that would allow the democratization of data inside the company: from sales, to marketing, to operations, the different teams should be using contextual data in their day-to-day
Some experience building extract, transform, load (ETL) data pipelines will be needed here.
You will analyze performance of our current Contextual products and actively proposing improvements together with the Product Team
Finally, you will build a strong knowledge of the ecosystem and sector to develop a strong instinct of how to improve our products and positioning. Creativity here will also be a must!
During all these tasks, you will be using the latest technologies developed by our Machine Learning Engineers: amazing NLP and CV models to get the most out of massive amounts of data!




YOU WILL SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE IF

You have a relevant degree in engineering, mathematics, statistics or an analytics related field
You have between 1 and 3 years of work experience in Data Analysis or a related field
You are proficient in SQL and Python: data treatment and data visualizations are a must
You have an analytical mind capable of structuring complex problems into simple, iterative, solutions
You have full proficiency in Spanish and English
You are energetic, proactive and eager to work in a dynamic environment
You are a real team player with good communication and cooperation skills
You have proven ability to work in a fast-paced, informal, dynamic and exigent environment
You like to have fun while working and don‚Äôt take yourself too serious!




It would be a big plus if you

Have previous experience in a startup or have a background in consulting
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders




SEEDTAG PERKS

üöÄ Key moment to join Seedtag in terms of growth and opportunities

üíØ One Seedtag: Work for a month from any of our open offices with travel and stay paid if you‚Äôre a top performer (think of Brazil, NY..., üèñÔ∏è)

‚åõ Flexible schedule to balance work and personal life

üá¨üáß üá™üá∏ üá´üá∑ Optional company-paid English, Spanish and/or French courses

üìö Access to learning opportunities (learning & development budget)

üçª We love what we do, but we also love having fun. We have many team activities you can join and enjoy with your colleagues! A Yearly offsite with all the company, team offsites, and Christmas events.

üèã Gympass




BENEFITS OF WORKING AT SEEDTAG

Growth: International, highly demanding work environment in one of the fastest growing AdTech companies in Europe. We reject "that‚Äôs the way it‚Äôs always been done". In Seedtag you can find an energetic, fresh workplace, multicultural work environment where our members are from different countries in Europe, LATAM, US and so many more!
Impact: The chance to have a direct impact, here you don't work for the sake of working, we all have an impact on seedtag in our own way, rowing in the same direction.
Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a total flexible methodology.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you, you can work from home, the beach or the office. The important thing is to work on your goals.




Are you ready to join the SEEDTAG adventure? Then send us your CV!

  • You are proficient in SQL and Python: data treatment and data visualizations are a must
  • You have an analytical mind capable of structuring complex problems into simple, iterative, solutions
  • You have full proficiency in Spanish and English
  • You are energetic, proactive and eager to work in a dynamic environment
  • You are a real team player with good communication and cooperation skills
  • You have proven ability to work in a fast-paced, informal, dynamic and exigent environment
  • You like to have fun while working and don‚Äôt take yourself too serious!


It would be a big plus if you

  • Have previous experience in a startup or have a background in consulting
  • Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders


SEEDTAG PERKS

üöÄ Key moment to join Seedtag in terms of growth and opportunities

üíØ One Seedtag: Work for a month from any of our open offices with travel and stay paid if you‚Äôre a top performer (think of Brazil, NY..., üèñÔ∏è)

‚åõ Flexible schedule to balance work and personal life

üá¨üáß üá™üá∏ üá´üá∑ Optional company-paid English, Spanish and/or French courses

üìö Access to learning opportunities (learning & development budget)

üçª We love what we do, but we also love having fun. We have many team activities you can join and enjoy with your colleagues! A Yearly offsite with all the company, team offsites, and Christmas events.

üèã Gympass


BENEFITS OF WORKING AT SEEDTAG

  • Growth: International, highly demanding work environment in one of the fastest growing AdTech companies in Europe. We reject "that‚Äôs the way it‚Äôs always been done". In Seedtag you can find an energetic, fresh workplace, multicultural work environment where our members are from different countries in Europe, LATAM, US and so many more!
  • Impact: The chance to have a direct impact, here you don't work for the sake of working, we all have an impact on seedtag in our own way, rowing in the same direction.
  • Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a total flexible methodology.
  • Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you, you can work from home, the beach or the office. The important thing is to work on your goals.


Are you ready to join the SEEDTAG adventure? Then send us your CV!

Title: Data Portfolio Analyst
Description:
ABOUT AXA




Whatever their stage of life, we provide over 108 million customers with the products and services they need to progress. From insurance to personal protection, and savings to wealth management, no matter the need we‚Äôre always there for them. And we‚Äôre always there for our employees. In 50 countries, we work hard to inspire pride and a sense of belonging in our people. To provide opportunities that challenge them, inspire them, and reward them. And to create a culture that‚Äôs open, supportive, and empowering. Because we know that‚Äôs the real secret to success ‚Äì and the best way for us to keep building a better world for both our customers and the talented people who put them first.




Your work environment:




The headquarters of the AXA Group (GIE AXA) brings together our corporate activities. It provides guidance and support to subsidiaries around the world, to ensure the coordination and monitoring of the Group's global strategy, the application of its standards, the consistency of commercial approaches and the sharing of best practices. The headquarters gathers approximately 1000 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (45 nationalities), which makes it a rich and stimulating place to work.




Within the Group, you will join the newly created Global Chief Underwriting Office (GUO) in charge of establishing, enabling, and driving profit and growth through Insurance Product Underwriting Strategy, Portfolio Design and Technical Underwriting Excellence & monitoring in partnership with the AXA Entities, for all lines of Business.




Data is a key part of AXA‚Äôs Strategic Plan ‚ÄúUnlock the Future‚Äù and the transformation of the organization as a Data Driven company. To succeed in this journey, we are looking for our Data Portfolio Analyst.




If you ‚Ä¶

Are a data-driven and a data passionate person,
Driven by value creation through data use and projects,
Eager to learn every day something new and meeting challenges

‚Ä¶this position is made for you!







Your job and daily missions:

P&C Commercial Line Group Underwriting Office is looking for a ‚ÄúData Portfolio Analyst‚Äù to join the Business Performance team. The Data Portfolio Analyst will play a key contributing role in ensuring Data assets meet objectives in terms of Quality, Timeline & Benefits:

Support P&C CL Underwriting teams in their strategic initiatives related to data framework/governance implementation in various P&C business processes: P&C Technical Performance Monitoring, Natural Catastrophes data Management across the Group (NatViews), Energy Transition & Sustainability (e.g. ESG),‚Ä¶
Lead / Participate to transversal projects & use cases related to Data Mesh and Gen AI, and be a Data Governance referent, working closely with Data Owners (Finance, Risk, Underwriting, entities,‚Ä¶) and Data Stewards (Technology & Data teams, Corporate Data Center,‚Ä¶) to answer their questions, provide orientations and ensure data framework is enforced
Perform data cartography and mapping exercises with business teams in order to document the relevant processes, technical storage items (tools) and relevant data to be included in our data governance framework
Collaborate with data transversal stakeholders (Group Risk Management, Group Finance, AXA Group Operations,‚Ä¶) to ensure global alignment on data policy and effective usage by P&C CL operational teams
Master tool capabilities both from an end-user perspective (browsing, search, views‚Ä¶) and from an admin one (import/export data, data quality review, access rights management‚Ä¶)
Promote data culture across Group Underwriting Office and contribute to the improvement of data maturity through diverse communication formats and events







Let‚Äôs talk about you:




Master‚Äôs degree in business or engineering, with a business data orientation
Around 3 to 5 years‚Äô experience as a Data / BI business analyst. Experience in Insurance and/or Consulting would be appreciated.
Knowledge in data projects management, ideally in major and multi-cultural organizations with large-scale data.
Fluency in English, verbal and written
Good data processing/visualization and technical skills, with confirmed knowledge of Excel, SQL, BI tools (e.g. PowerBI & Tableau), Python, R
Computer literate including Microsoft Office Package
Inquisitive mind with compelling analytical thinking skills
Ability to work with team globally located and cross-functionally, with entrepreneurial spirit and ambition to drive change







What we offer




You will join:




A company with an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce, committed to attract, develop, advance, and retain the most diverse talents, while creating an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their full selves to work and can reach their highest potential.
A company with strong values
A company promoting internal mobility and the training of its employees
A company offering many benefits (learn more here: Reward & Benefits | AXA Group)A flexible company, allowing hybrid work, in the office and from home
A responsible company, towards people, including its employees and customers, and towards the planet




As part of your job application, your personal data will be processed by GIE AXA - 23 avenue Matignon 75008 France. For more information about the processing of your personal data, please refer to the candidate information notice (link).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Role

We are looking for a Social Media Data Analyst to create and manage insights and analytics solutions that turn data into powerful insights. In this role, you should have a background in data and business analysis. You should be analytical and an excellent communicator. If you also have business acumen and problem-solving aptitude, we‚Äôd like to meet you. Ultimately, you will enhance our business intelligence system to help us make better decisions.

Responsibilities



Translate business needs to technical specifications.
Marketing analytics partner to feed the marketing team with insights from their own social accounts and social listening.
Ability to work with large volumes of data and find the story in the metrics, create and communicate insights by analysing data from a variety of sources, both quantitative and qualitative;
Build Insights reports weekly.
Collaborate with local and external multicultural teams to integrate strategic and creative processes.
Work closely with direct external suppliers, third-party vendors, agencies, and relevant external networks.
Develop and execute database queries and conduct analyses.
Create visualisations and reports for requested projects
Analyse big data to discover trends and patterns



About You



Experience working in Digital and Social Media (Social Listening or Business Intelligence)
Strong knowledge of how Social Media platforms work (Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, YouTube)
Strong knowledge of Social Media Listening Tools (such as Sprinklr, Brandwatch, Talkwalker, etc will be considered an extra)
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel is a must
Industry experience is a must
Excellent organisational, interpersonal, and communication skills (both written and verbal).
Understanding of Branding, Marketing, and Research Communication;
Familiarity with BI technologies (e.g. Microsoft Power BI, Oracle BI)
Proven abilities to take initiative and be innovative
Analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude
Proficiency in English. (Spanish will be considered an extra)
Knowledge of SQL queries, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Knowledge of using programming languages (such as VBA macros, python, javascript) to automate analysis and reporting processes will be highly valued
Fluency with visualisation tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.) ‚Äì the ability to create interactive, user-friendly, and compelling dashboards and reports.



At .Monks, we believe in fostering an environment where a diversity of perspectives can thrive. We proactively work to design hiring processes that promote equity and inclusion while mitigating bias. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a team that reflects the communities we serve. We welcome and encourage qualified applicants, from all backgrounds, who are excited to contribute to our mission.

About Monks

Monks is the global, purely digital, unitary operating brand of S4Capital plc. With a legacy of innovation and specialized expertise, Monks combines an extraordinary range of global marketing and technology services to accelerate business possibilities and redefine how brands and businesses interact with the world. Its integration of systems and workflows delivers unfettered content production, scaled experiences, enterprise-grade technology and data science fueled by AI‚Äîmanaged by the industry‚Äôs best and most diverse digital talent‚Äîto help the world‚Äôs trailblazing companies outmaneuver and outpace their competition.

Monks was named a Contender in The Forrester Wave‚Ñ¢: Global Marketing Services. It has remained a constant presence on Adweek‚Äôs Fastest Growing lists (2019-23), ranks among Cannes Lions' Top 10 Creative Companies (2022-23) and is the only partner to have been placed in AdExchanger‚Äôs Programmatic Power Players list every year (2020-24). In addition to being named Adweek‚Äôs first AI Agency of the Year (2023), Monks has been recognized by Business Intelligence in its 2024 Excellence in Artificial Intelligence Awards program in three categories: the Individual category, Organizational Winner in AI Strategic Planning and AI Product for its service Monks.Flow. Monks has also garnered the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-24), won a record number of FWAs and has earned a spot on Newsweek‚Äôs Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023.

We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a respectful and empowering work environment for all people to freely express themselves amongst colleagues who embrace diversity in all respects. Including fresh voices and unique points of view in all aspects of our business not only creates an environment where we can all grow and thrive but also increases our potential to produce work that better represents‚Äîand resonates with‚Äîthe world around us.

While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.

Title: Data Analyst (Online Sales)
Description:
¬øTienes ganas de dar forma al futuro de los seguros?

En Prima, podr√≠as asumir un reto totalmente nuevo. Como parte de nuestra comunidad global, estar√°s en el asiento del conductor de tu carrera, aprendiendo y creciendo con un equipo de primer nivel a tu alrededor. Prima es un lugar en el que, independientemente de qui√©n seas o cu√°l sea tu funci√≥n, se valora tu voz.

En 2015, nos embarcamos en una misi√≥n: ofrecer un seguro de coche de gran valor dise√±ado para todos. Y hemos recorrido un largo camino, hemos creado una cultura en la que podemos impulsar el √©xito de los dem√°s. Pero necesitamos tu experiencia, ya que dirigimos las cosas en una direcci√≥n nueva y emocionante.

Probablemente est√©s pensando... "Esto suena muy bien". Estamos de acuerdo.

Adem√°s de grandes compa√±eros y proyectos interesantes, hay muchas maneras de ayudarte a hacer el mejor trabajo de tu vida. Hemos configurado nuestra oferta para centrarnos en el bienestar, la autonom√≠a y el desarrollo. Consideramos que los beneficios son el combustible que te permitir√° alcanzar el √©xito si decides embarcarte en este viaje con nosotros.

ü§∏üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Trabajar de la mejor manera para ti

Creemos en la conciliaci√≥n y la flexibilidad. Tanto si te gusta trabajar desde la oficina, desde casa o una mezcla de ambas. Te ayudaremos a encontrar el equilibrio que mejor se adapte a ti. Incluso tenemos una pol√≠tica que te permite trabajar desde cualquier lugar durante 30 d√≠as al a√±o. Confiamos en ti para que nos ayudes a avanzar.

üèÅ La libertad de explorar las posibilidades

En Prima nos movemos r√°pido, pero nos movemos juntos. Invertimos en tu crecimiento; por eso te daremos acceso a un mercado de ense√±anza y aprendizaje. Y tendr√°s sesiones regulares con tu manager para establecer un plan de crecimiento personal.

üåà Nuestra f√≥rmula ganadora: felices y de alto rendimiento

Desde seguros m√©dicos privados hasta descuentos en gimnasios e iniciativas de bienestar: estamos aqu√≠ para ayudarte. Sabemos lo importantes que son tu salud y tu bienestar, as√≠ que haremos todo lo posible para ayudarte.

Si te parece que tenemos algo para ti, veamos si tienes las aptitudes que buscamos

Te incorporar√°s como Data Analyst en el equipo de Online Sales & Marketing para apoyar a identificar y mejorar iniciativas de crecimiento y de eficiencia del negocio, analizando los principales factores que est√°n afectando y/o condicionando nuestro desempe√±o y resultados en ventas y en retenci√≥n de p√≥lizas.

En concreto, trabajar√°s con los diferentes equipos de Prima, con las siguientes responsabilidades:

Conversi√≥n online


Analizar los factores que impactan la conversi√≥n del funnel de los usuarios que llegan a nuestra p√°gina web por los diferentes canales, apoy√°ndote en el an√°lisis detallado de datos y en las herramientas de an√°lisis web como Google Analytics y Content Square e interactuando con equipos de Product y de UX para identificar mejoras.
Crear y mantener dashboards en Tableau para respaldar las decisiones estrat√©gicas del equipo de Online Sales y dar soporte a los equipos de Product y Product Analytics.

Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst‚Äì Data Science & BI (ODS)
Description:
Country: Spain

Business Intelligence Data Analyst‚Äì Data Science & BI (ODS)

Open Digital Services is a tech company with a unique culture, dedicated to creating innovative products for Santander Group Affiliates. Open Digital Services is part of the Retail & Commercial Division of Santander Group, one of the world's largest financial institutions and the Eurozone's leader, we're committed to being the best Digital Bank with Branches in the industry.

Our mission at ODS is to design and support an advanced digital and omnichannel platform, ensuring the best customer experience using cutting-edge technology. Openbank, our flagship partner, is where we develop our most advanced concepts. Be part of our Best-in-Class tech team and help us create unique value for our customers!

Join us to tackle exciting tech challenges in an agile environment, benefiting from learning, growth, and local and international career opportunities in a modern, diverse setting.

Mission and responsibilities:

We are seeking an innovative and passionate Data Analyst to build a reference Business Intelligence Platform of the newly created function created within the Retail & Commercial Unit for Santander.

One of the main products will be the creation of dashboards that will serve as the central hub for our financial operations across multiple countries, providing critical insights and fostering data-driven decision-making. You will report to the product owner and work closely with other data analysts, data engineers, and stakeholders from various departments to ensure the dashboard meets the needs of our global business.

The main tasks of this position will be the following:


Collecting and interpreting data from different sources in our AWS Datalake.
Analysing results from different commercial actions and drive insights that can lead to optimizing our business.
Reporting the results back to the relevant members of the business, using data visualization tools.
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets, as well as automate these tasks so we can spend less time reviewing normality and more time analyzing interesting anomalous patterns.
Defining new data collection and analysis processes from our different business verticals.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
Ability to identify and automate recurring tasks (through scripts or dashboards).
Create a repository of key queries (really useful queries could be interesting for the rest of the team and for your future work).
Generate documentation of all the processes to facilitate their understanding, transfer or backup.


To be successful in the role you must have:


+5-8 years of experience in a similar role.
Computational Skilled Degree (Computer Science, Telecomm., etc..)
Statistical analysis: you know the basic statistical concepts and know how to implement them in different programming languages (ideally Python or Spark, and less ideally R üòâ). You know when to use different indicators and have experience summarizing data insights with them.
Dealing with large datasets and implementing scalable solutions. You know what data cleaning means and how to interact with a data engineer.
How to solve problems using data: analyze the problem and decompose it into different analytical components and recycle all the components you can from other projects.
Software development: you know what git means, and how to develop your own code, test it and use it to produce actionable results. Open-source lovers get a plus if you show us your github!
Data Visualization, and tools like Power BI (highly appreciated), matplotlib, tableau, or similar. Bonus points for QuickSight.
You are an SQL-ninja, writing simple exploratory or efficient queries won't be a problem for you.


What do we offer?


Joining a dynamic and agile company undergoing international expansion.
Working in start-up mode with the support of the Santander Group.
Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.


Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

ODS is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered as equal without paying attention to gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, age, political orientation, union membership nor disability status.

We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify, and build.

The personal data you provide as well as any data generated during the selection process are confidential and will be processed by Open Bank, S.A./ Open Digital Services, S.L. with registered office at Plaza de Santa B√°rbara 2, 28004 (Madrid), for the sole purpose of managing your participation in the selection processes and, where appropriate, to formalise your recruitment.‚ÄØ

For further information about your rights and data protection, please read the ODS/Openbank Privacy Policy applicable to this type of data processing here.‚ÄØ

Title: Data Analyst & BI - Remoto Espa√±a
Description:
The Wise Seeker is the leading HR technology company in unbiased talent evaluation.With over 15 years in the industry analyzing the needs and demands of the job market, we are capable of identifying the best talent for each company thanks to our team of professionals and our SaaS platform integrated with Artificial Intelligence.We are efficient, evaluate talent objectively without bias, and close hiring times in record time, delivering optimal results.

As a Data Analyst & BI Specialist, you will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets and developing BI solutions to support strategic decision-making. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to identify business needs and deliver data-driven insights.

Key Responsibilities:


Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to identify trends and patterns.
Develop and maintain BI dashboards and reports using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into data models and visualizations.
Conduct ad-hoc analyses to support business initiatives and decision-making.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide insights to improve business processes.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across all reports and dashboards.
Stay current with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and BI.


Benefits:


Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
Flexible working hours and remote work options.
Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
A collaborative and innovative work culture.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a driven and successful Data Analyst to help our client sales teams worldwide grow, meet, and exceed their business targets.




As a Data Analyst focused on supporting the Sales team, you will be responsible for building and maintaining data and reporting capabilities, performing in-depth analysis of sales patterns, estimating the effectiveness of monetisation efforts, and providing actionable insights to both the sales teams and management.




You will contribute to key areas such as lead generation, user attribution infrastructure, and monetisation solutions, playing a critical role in driving revenue growth and expanding the brand‚Äôs customer base.




We need someone who is highly proficient with data infrastructure and reporting tools, understands the sales domain, and is genuinely interested in driving business outcomes.




What‚Äôs in it for you?




Great salary | High impact role | Scale up with high potential | Career growth | 100% Remote




Responsibilities:




Support the data infrastructure for sales: the company already has a basic data infrastructure in place, including a data warehouse (Redshift), integrated sales tools, and basic sales reporting in Tableau. They expect you to adapt this infrastructure to accommodate changes, develop more advanced reports, build new integrations, and ensure the quality and accuracy of the data.
Regularly report on the performance of the sales teams: Help develop and track appropriate KPIs.
Perform deep analysis of sales data: Focus primarily on internal data but also include external data where possible. Identify patterns and provide insights regarding offers, strategy changes, lead quality, and market shifts.
Work directly with sales teams, management, and, when necessary, marketing/development: Visualise and explain sales metrics and insights at various levels of complexity.
Form hypotheses, suggest improvements, and organise testing: Collaborate with the teams to test these hypotheses and implement improvements.




Requirements:




3+ years of experience in analytics/BI, ideally related to sales or marketing domains.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree, ideally with a focus on business administration, marketing, economics, or data processing (optional‚Äîcan be omitted if not critical).
Strong technical skills: Advanced SQL, ideally Python for automating tasks; understanding of basic statistics and A/B testing; experience with visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker); and the ability to work with raw data.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills: Ability to derive insights, form, and test hypotheses to improve business results.
Sales domain knowledge (familiarity with sales data and reporting, CRM systems, lead generation, and sales processes) is a significant advantage.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal: Ability to clearly explain complex analytical concepts to different audiences, from sales agents to company management.
Obsession with business results: Understanding of business impact and the ability to work independently or within a team to continuously improve outcomes.
Fluency in English (native-level preferred). Spanish is a significant advantage; Russian would also be beneficial.
Experience working with B2B apps in a growth stage is also a plus.




Ready to make a significant impact? If you‚Äôre a driven Data Analyst with a passion for sales and marketing analytics, we want to hear from you! Apply now via Prosperity and help drive growth and success for our client‚Äôs sales teams worldwide.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a talented Business Data Analyst to help us change the world of digital advertising!




WHO WE ARE

Seedtag is the leading Contextual Advertising Platform. Our proprietary, machine learning-based technology provides human-like understanding of the content in the web, the highest level of brand safety in the industry and unmatched cookieless targeting capabilities.

We engage with the market on both demand and supply side to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.




KEY FIGURES

2014 ¬∑ Founded by two ex-Googlers

2018 ¬∑ 16M total turnover & Internationalization & Getting growth

2021 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 40M‚Ç¨ & +10 countries & +230 Seedtaggers

2022 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 250M‚Ç¨ + expansion into the U.S market + 400 Seedtaggers




YOUR CHALLENGE

You will get full ownership of our business data, and will be expected to propose and conduct analyses that transform Seedtag‚Äôs data into significant business opportunities and KPI improvements.
You will analyze the performance of our current Contextual products and processes and proactively propose initiatives that seek to improve Seedtag‚Äôs commercial and operational results.
You will develop tools that automate internal processes, increasing efficiency and efficacy of Seedtag teams.
You will help build tools that enable the democratization of data inside the company, and allow Seedtag teams to make informed, data-driven decisions.
Finally, you will build a solid knowledge of the adTech ecosystem and develop strong business acumen.




YOU WILL SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE IF

You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Engineering. Specific certifications / education in Data / Business Intelligence are a plus.
You have 3-5 years of experience in a fast-paced environment, either start-up, corporate or consulting.
You have advanced skills in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
You have experience with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools.
You have knowledge of database management systems (e.g., BigQuery, MySQL).
You have experience working with programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and manipulation.
You have experience in data visualization tools such as Looker, Power BI, or similar and you have knowledge of Excel/ Sheets.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights that drive business value.
You have the ability to collaborate with business stakeholders to identify information needs and define business requirements.
You have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders




It would be a big plus if you

Have experience in forecasting, trend analysis, and predictive modeling
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders




SEEDTAG PERKS

üöÄ Key moment to join Seedtag in terms of growth and opportunities

üíØ One Seedtag: Work for a month from any of our open offices with travel and stay paid if you‚Äôre a top performer (think of Brazil, Mexico..., üèñÔ∏è)

üçΩÔ∏èüöò Access to a flexible benefits plan with restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten tickets and discounts on medical insurance

‚åõ Flexible schedule to balance work and personal life

üèã Gympass

üá¨üáß üá™üá∏ üá´üá∑ Optional company-paid English, Spanish and/or French courses

üìö Access to learning opportunities (learning & development budget)

üçª We love what we do, but we also love having fun. We have many team activities you can join and enjoy with your colleagues!




BENEFITS OF WORKING AT SEEDTAG

Growth: International, highly demanding work environment in one of the fastest growing AdTech companies in Europe. We reject "that‚Äôs the way it‚Äôs always been done". In Seedtag you can find an energetic, fresh workplace, multicultural work environment where our members are from different countries in Europe, LATAM, US and so many more!
Impact: The chance to have a direct impact, here you don't work for the sake of working, we all have an impact on seedtag in our own way, rowing in the same direction.
Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a total flexible methodology.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you, you can work from home, the beach or the office. The important thing is to work on your goals.




Are you ready to join the SEEDTAG adventure? Then send us your CV!

  • Realizar an√°lisis de datos ad-hoc para identificar tendencias, patrones y oportunidades de mejora.
  • Participar en la integraci√≥n de nuevos conjuntos de datos y fuentes de datos para enriquecer el an√°lisis existente.
  • Documentar procesos y metodolog√≠as utilizadas en el desarrollo de informes y an√°lisis.


Requisitos:


  • Experiencia demostrable en el desarrollo de informes y an√°lisis utilizando PowerBI.
  • Conocimiento s√≥lido de SQL para consultar bases de datos y realizar an√°lisis de datos.
  • Experiencia en el dise√±o y optimizaci√≥n de modelos de datos en plataformas como Azure Synapse.
  • Capacidad para trabajar de manera independiente y colaborativa en un entorno de equipo.
  • Capacidad para gestionar m√∫ltiples proyectos y prioridades en un entorno din√°mico.
  • Valorable disponer de certificaciones adicionales en BI y plataformas de nube.
  • Imprescindible contar con disponibilidad para trabajar en jornada 100% presencial.


Ofrecemos un proyecto estable en una compa√±√≠a consolidada y l√≠der de su sector, donde podr√°s desarrollarte profesionalmente con condiciones competitivas.

Title: Data Analyst - Finance (f/m/d)
Description:
Purpose of Position

Awin‚Äôs Financial Analysts serve as a pivotal resource in shaping the company's financial future and strategic direction through expert data analysis and insightful financial modelling. This role enhances decision-making across the organisation by providing precise, data-driven insights and actionable recommendations to optimise performance and drive growth.

Key Tasks


Financial & Business Analytics Reporting: Develop and maintain reporting using Tableau to track key performance indicators, financial metrics, and other critical data points relevant to business operations
Financial Modelling: Create detailed financial models that forecast business performance and simulate various financial scenarios to aid in strategic planning and decision-making
Insight Generation: Analyse data and report outcomes to provide actionable insights that support business objectives and drive efficiency improvements
Stakeholder Communication: Present complex analysis and reports to stakeholders in a clear and accessible manner, ensuring that technical and non-technical audiences understand the implications and insights
Continuous Improvement: Continually refine and enhance data collection, analysis, and reporting processes using BI tools to better meet the company‚Äôs strategic needs.


Skills & Expertise


3+ years in a financial or business analytics position
Analytical, pro-active and inquisitive, with the ability to take ownership and deliver projects independently
The ideal candidate possesses exceptional communication skills, with a proven ability to distil complex technical concepts into clear, concise explanations for non-technical audiences
Proficiency with SQL and Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau is essential
Fluency in English (C1+)


Our Offer


Flexi-Week and Work-Life Balance: We prioritise your mental health and wellbeing, offering you a flexible four-day Flexi-Week at full pay and with no reduction to your annual holiday allowance. We also offer a variety of different paid special leaves.
Flexi-Office: Do you prefer to work from our cool office, from home, or in a completely different environment? With us, the choice is yours. We‚ÄØoffer the flexibility to work wherever you want‚ÄØwithin our Awin locations.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Health & Well Being: With our support and access to various initiatives and sports offers, you can devote yourself to your mental and physical well-being.
Development: We‚Äôve built our extensive training suite Awin Academy to cover a wide range of skills that nurture you professionally and personally, with trainings conveniently packaged together to support your overall development. You can also improve your English skills by participating in our local language course.
Remote Working: You will receive a monthly allowance to cover part of your running costs. In addition, we will support you in setting up your remote workspace appropriately.
Appreciation: Thank and reward colleagues by sending them a voucher through our peer-to-peer program and show your appreciation‚ÄØfor‚ÄØcolleagues who have gone‚ÄØthe extra mile‚ÄØto support‚ÄØyou.


Established in 2000, Awin is proud of our dynamic, social and inclusive culture.

Like all businesses, we‚Äôve had to adapt and nurture our culture in a virtual environment. Our virtual ‚ÄòLife @ Awin‚Äô hub brings our colleagues from across the globe together for various social activities.

Diversity & Inclusion are paramount to us, and we proudly pursue and hire diverse team members. We champion uniqueness and authenticity; this is who we are at our core. Our network of affiliate partnerships are diverse and transparent, as are the employees powering our vision to build the world‚Äôs leading open partner ecosystem. We welcome all backgrounds, identities, and experiences. If you need support at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Apply now to begin the next stage of your career at a progressive company that supports both your professional and personal development.

Title: Finance Data Analysis
Description:
About MAXAM

At MAXAM we work to offer our clients throughout the world a wide range of products and services, generating solutions, and full technical support to respond to their most specific needs.

Since our founding in 1872 by Alfred Nobel, MAXAM has grown by leaps and bounds. We are now a global company specializing in energy materials. We apply all our talent, energy and knowledge to the mining and civil engineering sectors, anywhere in the world. A lot has changed since Alfred Nobel started the business but some things haven¬¥t changed: our dedication to our people to achieve excellence in what we do.







What are we looking for?

A Junior Finance or Industrial engineer profile with data analytics skills to join the corporate team in Madrid. This position must perform the following tasks:




- Elaboration and analysis of the key projects monthly financial reporting (Sales/EBITDA, Gross margin, Trade working capital & overdues, etc.).

- Elaboration and monitoring of the projects operational KPI‚Äôs.

- Leading with Project Managers the definition and follow up of projects performance improvement plans.

- Elaboration, review and monitoring of projects Business Plans and scenario simulations.

- Modelling of processes and tools to help improve control over formulations.




Minimum requirements:

-Bachelor degree in Business Administration, Economics, Industrial Engineer or similar.

-Excellent oral and written communication skills in English.

-Previous experience in Audit Firm (Big Four) at least 1 year.

- Availability to travel.

- High level in MS Excel

- Experience with ERPs.

- Strong financial and accounting fundamentals.

- Experience in elaboration of Powerpoint presentations and experience in PowerBI is a plus.




Competencies:

Analitical capacity

Initiative

Teamwork

Pressure tolerance

Problem solving

Planning & organization




What we offer?

Permanent contract

Grow within a multinational environment

Flexible compensation package

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who are we?

We are South Europe Technologies (S.ET); the IT, Data and Operations Shared Service Center of BNP Paribas Personal Finance, with delivery centers in Spain and Portugal, providing the best solutions to BNPP PF entities around the world such as Cetelem (specialized, between others, in financial partnership of major retailers, consumer goods companies and car dealerships).

Among Other Services, Our Portfolio Is Composed Of


Applications Management (Architecture, Project Management, Development, and Quality Assurance).
IT Risks & Cybersecurity Services.
Platforms Management.
Data Analytics and AI.
Operations.


Our offices are in Spain (Madrid) and Portugal (Lisbon, Porto). The company brings together over 200+ employees, with expertise in various technologies (Java, .Net, Python, Tibco, APIGee) and other operational roles (Functional Analyst, Project Manager, Business Analyst, Auto Stock Financing operators). We keep growing!

Our consistent track record of services delivery means comfort for our customers and opportunities for our employees.

You will find SE.T to be full of energy and an Inclusive Workplace in which you truly can make a difference.

Would you like to join our international team that delivers end-to-end solutions (applications and operations activities) to businesses of BNP Paribas Personal Finance Group entities around the world?

In a context of maintaining the high level of existing activities while growing the number of international customers, we are looking for our Data Analyst.

Mission

We are searching for the best talent to provide analytical and reporting support to the Data Office perimeter to optimize decision making and develop cross-functional data products.

Main Responsibilities


Perform data analysis: Provide conclusions, propose improvements, identify, or solve problems, or investigate business questions based on data.
Reporting: Implement and analyze data plans based on the measurement needs of your internal customers. Automate reports, design, and manage the publication of dashboards on visualization tools such as Power BI and Tableau.
Technically responsible for the data domains under the responsibility of the Data Office: Support to the definition and implementation of controls, management of registrations and modifications of the necessary views in the Information Center/Datahub, etc.
Manage the technical development of analytical products by coordinating resources from Central analytical Hubs: Reporting, ML models, ad-hoc analysis, data exploration, etc.
Contribute to the proposals on technological platforms and governance model elaborated by the Data Office with its opinion and experience.


What We Are Looking For


Academic background: Degree / Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics, Big Data or equivalent experience.
You have two years of proven working experience in the data transformation to extract key insights using statistical/analytical concepts.
Proven experience in execution and automation of ETL's based on SAS, SQL or others.
Knowledge of Phyton, Dataiku and Dremio.
You are engaged in day-to-day activities.
You have a transformation mindset, looking for the excellency.
You are a Problem-Solving and Decision-Making person, who:
Demonstrates advanced analytical and diagnostic skills dealing with issues that are ambiguous, lack known precedent or appear contradictory.
Sees the big picture and is fully aware of technology and business directions.
Has department, corporate and group objectives in focus while identifying and removing barriers.


Skills


Communication skills - Oral & Written.
Ability to collaborate/Teamwork.
Proactivity.
Organized, efficient, and able to meet deadlines.
Gives and welcomes feedback. Puts success of the business and team above own interest.
Experience in the Finance sector is a plus.
Management of the MS Office package (Excel, Power Point, SharePoint, One Note knowledge).
Management of visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI.
Fluent level of English and Spanish is a must. Any other European language is nice to have.


About Our Culture

We are proud to create, maintain and develop business solutions for BNP Paribas Group entities around the world, while keeping a high level of service and providing added value to our customers.

Working in an Inclusive and Multicultural environment, we encourage everyone to develop their talents and skills, offering various career opportunities and internal mobility programs, within local SET teams or in other entities within the Group.

We value our employees' experience by keeping a well-balanced environment with flexibility regarding the work schedule and care for everyone's personal time.

We embraced a hybrid way of working because we believe social connection always adds value to our day-to-day activities.

Benefits


Training programs, career plans and internal mobility opportunities, national and international thanks to our presence in different countries.
Diversity and Inclusion Committee that ensures an inclusive work environment. In recent years, several employee communities have been created to organize diversity and inclusion awareness actions (PRIDE, We Generations and MixCity).
Corporate volunteering program (1 Million Hours 2 Help) in which employees can dedicate time out of their working hours to volunteer activities.
Flexible compensation plan.
Hybrid telecommuting model (50%).
31 vacation days.


Diversity and inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Group in Spain is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description

About Liferay

Liferay is a uniquely profitable B2B enterprise software company with 1,200+ fiery-eyed employees all across Europe, the Americas, the Middle East, Asia, and Africa. As a renowned provider of enterprise open source technologies, we have been recognized by Gartner for empowering businesses around the world to solve complex digital challenges. Liferay Experience Cloud is an all-in-one solution that unites our Liferay DXP and cloud platform capabilities with built-in analytics and B2B commerce functionality, reducing the time to market and allowing for accelerated innovation - serving notable customers across the globe such as Airbus, US Bank, Honda, and Desjardins.

But we don‚Äôt just make awesome software, we are also fueled by a greater-than-profit vision. By building a vibrant business, making technology useful, and investing in communities, we make it possible for people to reach their full potential to serve others. We give our employees five days off to volunteer at charities they‚Äôre excited about, and Liferay donates 10% of our profits to charities around the world. Oh, we‚Äôre also self-funded which gives us the freedom to work on whatever we think brings the most value to customers and communities in the long run!

About You And This Role

You have that rare ability to bridge two worlds, the human and the technical. You can draw out complex ideas

from stakeholders and distill them into achievable goals. You understand the synergy between requirements

and test plans and are experienced in driving product improvements from requirements gathering till

completion. You like being given the space to run in a global open source company to help deliver creations

that are intuitive and sharp. Sounds like you? Apply now and let‚Äôs chat.

Key Objectives


Support data collection efforts by identifying relevant data sources and working with stakeholders to understand their data needs.
Assist in data cleaning, transformation, and preparation for analysis using your SQL techniques.
Perform basic data analysis under guidance, identifying trends and patterns.
Support the creation of clear and informative reports and dashboards to monitor key metrics as well as maintain current dashboards and reports used to support critical business monitoring goals.
Convey insights through both reports, dashboards and visual presentations.
Collaborate with team members and cross functional teams to understand and support ongoing projects.
Assist in the development of self-service tools and internal documentation resources.
Seek opportunities to learn and apply new data analysis techniques and tools.
Contribute to a culture of data-driven decision making.


Required Qualifications


3+ years of work experience in Data Analysis, Business Analysis or relevant experience in analytical tasks or projects working with data.
Experience in working with multiple stakeholders and prioritizing competing requests.
Experience rolling out BI tools/metrics at a global level managing relationships with cross functional teams
Excellent decision-making, critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent oral and written English communication skills (minimum C1 level-proficient user)
Team player, with strong interpersonal skills and skilled in developing collaborative relationships.
Self-starter, quick learner, detail-oriented and proactive in completing responsibilities.
Highly motivated, independent and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact.
Demonstrated experience in data analysis languages as SQL, Python and/or R
Story- telling and visualizing, experience in Tableau or otherBI/Reporting tools


Preferred Qualifications


BA/BS degree in Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar, or 5+ years of equivalent work experience.
Experience with JIRA


What We Offer


Salary package w/ competitive benefits according to qualifications and experience
Opportunities to take responsibility, grow professionally, and Stay Nerdy
A positive and collaborative work culture
Check out what employees say about us on Glassdoor
Working at a leading open-source company


Equal Opportunities Employer - Statement

Liferay is committed to the equal treatment of all candidates, customers and employees and to fostering a culture of dignity at work. Our operating procedure provides for equal opportunities in recruitment and employment with the aim to eliminate discrimination against any job applicant or employee on the basis of race, age, sexual orientation, gender, religion or beliefs, marital or civil partnerships status, family or dependency status, disability, pregnancy and maternity or membership of a traveling community.

Title: Data Analyst - Banking
Description:
Skill Farm Members are invited to apply for the following role:

Responsibilities:

As a Data Analyst, you will proactively connect Business areas and understand their needs, their services and products functioning and the data ecosystem, and can generate accurate data driven analysis and recommendations, as√â

Product analysis trends to increase sales conversion, reduce product attrition, improve digital funnels, support recurrent or ad hoc inbound/ outbound communication campaigns, etc.

Customer analysis to understand customer behavior, customer life time value, determine customer segmentation and create customer evolution forecast.

Support and advice business on their reporting needs and any other analytical need.

Skills & Qualifications:

Full proficiency in Excel, SAS and SQL (knowledge of other programming languages such as R or Python will be appreciated).

At least 3-6 years of experience in a comparable role, transforming data to extract key business insights using statistical/analytical concepts.

Your communication skills enable you to work together with many different parties throughout our organization.

Willing and able to learn and to improve your technical and your interpersonal skills.

Customer centric.

Fluent English will be appreciated.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who are we?

We are South Europe Technologies (S.ET); the IT, Data and Operations Shared Service Center of BNP Paribas Personal Finance, with delivery centers in Spain and Portugal, providing the best solutions to BNPP PF entities around the world such as Cetelem (specialized, between others, in financial partnership of major retailers, consumer goods companies and car dealerships).

Among Other Services, Our Portfolio Is Composed Of


Applications Management (Architecture, Project Management, Development, and Quality Assurance).
IT Risks & Cybersecurity Services.
Platforms Management.
Data Analytics and AI.
Operations.



Our offices are in Spain (Madrid) and Portugal (Lisbon, Porto). The company brings together over 200+ employees, with expertise in various technologies (Java, .Net, Python, Tibco, APIGee) and other operational roles (Functional Analyst, Project Manager, Business Analyst, Auto Stock Financing operators). We keep growing!

Our consistent track record of services delivery means comfort for our customers and opportunities for our employees.

You will find SE.T to be full of energy and an Inclusive Workplace in which you truly can make a difference.

Would you like to join our international team that delivers end-to-end solutions (applications and operations activities) to businesses of BNP Paribas Personal Finance Group entities around the world?

In a context of maintaining the high level of existing activities while growing the number of international customers, we are looking for our Data Analyst.

Mission

We are searching for the best talent to provide analytical and reporting support to the Data Office perimeter to optimize decision making and develop cross-functional data products.

Main Responsibilities


Perform data analysis: Provide conclusions, propose improvements, identify, or solve problems, or investigate business questions based on data.
Reporting: Implement and analyze data plans based on the measurement needs of your internal customers. Automate reports, design, and manage the publication of dashboards on visualization tools such as Power BI and Tableau.
Technically responsible for the data domains under the responsibility of the Data Office: Support to the definition and implementation of controls, management of registrations and modifications of the necessary views in the Information Center/Datahub, etc.
Manage the technical development of analytical products by coordinating resources from Central analytical Hubs: Reporting, ML models, ad-hoc analysis, data exploration, etc.
Contribute to the proposals on technological platforms and governance model elaborated by the Data Office with its opinion and experience.



What We Are Looking For


Academic background: Degree / Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics, Big Data or equivalent experience.
You have two years of proven working experience in the data transformation to extract key insights using statistical/analytical concepts.
Proven experience in execution and automation of ETL's based on SAS, SQL or others.
Knowledge of Phyton, Dataiku and Dremio.
You are engaged in day-to-day activities.
You have a transformation mindset, looking for the excellency.
You are a Problem-Solving and Decision-Making person, who:
Demonstrates advanced analytical and diagnostic skills dealing with issues that are ambiguous, lack known precedent or appear contradictory.
Sees the big picture and is fully aware of technology and business directions.
Has department, corporate and group objectives in focus while identifying and removing barriers.



Skills


Communication skills - Oral & Written.
Ability to collaborate/Teamwork.
Proactivity.
Organized, efficient, and able to meet deadlines.
Gives and welcomes feedback. Puts success of the business and team above own interest.
Experience in the Finance sector is a plus.
Management of the MS Office package (Excel, Power Point, SharePoint, One Note knowledge).
Management of visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI.
Fluent level of English and Spanish is a must. Any other European language is nice to have.



About Our Culture

We are proud to create, maintain and develop business solutions for BNP Paribas Group entities around the world, while keeping a high level of service and providing added value to our customers.

Working in an Inclusive and Multicultural environment, we encourage everyone to develop their talents and skills, offering various career opportunities and internal mobility programs, within local SET teams or in other entities within the Group.

We value our employees' experience by keeping a well-balanced environment with flexibility regarding the work schedule and care for everyone's personal time.

We embraced a hybrid way of working because we believe social connection always adds value to our day-to-day activities.

Benefits


Training programs, career plans and internal mobility opportunities, national and international thanks to our presence in different countries.
Diversity and Inclusion Committee that ensures an inclusive work environment. In recent years, several employee communities have been created to organize diversity and inclusion awareness actions (PRIDE, We Generations and MixCity).
Corporate volunteering program (1 Million Hours 2 Help) in which employees can dedicate time out of their working hours to volunteer activities.
Flexible compensation plan.
Hybrid telecommuting model (50%).
31 vacation days.



Diversity and inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Group in Spain is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.
Show more
HTML:
Who are we?

We are South Europe Technologies (S.ET); the IT, Data and Operations Shared Service Center of BNP Paribas Personal Finance, with delivery centers in Spain and Portugal, providing the best solutions to BNPP PF entities around the world such as Cetelem (specialized, between others, in financial partnership of major retailers, consumer goods companies and car dealerships).

Among Other Services, Our Portfolio Is Composed Of

  • Applications Management (Architecture, Project Management, Development, and Quality Assurance).
  • IT Risks & Cybersecurity Services.
  • Platforms Management.
  • Data Analytics and AI.
  • Operations.


Our offices are in Spain (Madrid) and Portugal (Lisbon, Porto). The company brings together over 200+ employees, with expertise in various technologies (Java, .Net, Python, Tibco, APIGee) and other operational roles (Functional Analyst, Project Manager, Business Analyst, Auto Stock Financing operators). We keep growing!

Our consistent track record of services delivery means comfort for our customers and opportunities for our employees.

You will find SE.T to be full of energy and an Inclusive Workplace in which you truly can make a difference.

Would you like to join our international team that delivers end-to-end solutions (applications and operations activities) to businesses of BNP Paribas Personal Finance Group entities around the world?

In a context of maintaining the high level of existing activities while growing the number of international customers, we are looking for our Data Analyst.

Mission

We are searching for the best talent to provide analytical and reporting support to the Data Office perimeter to optimize decision making and develop cross-functional data products.

Main Responsibilities

  • Perform data analysis: Provide conclusions, propose improvements, identify, or solve problems, or investigate business questions based on data.
  • Reporting: Implement and analyze data plans based on the measurement needs of your internal customers. Automate reports, design, and manage the publication of dashboards on visualization tools such as Power BI and Tableau.
  • Technically responsible for the data domains under the responsibility of the Data Office: Support to the definition and implementation of controls, management of registrations and modifications of the necessary views in the Information Center/Datahub, etc.
  • Manage the technical development of analytical products by coordinating resources from Central analytical Hubs: Reporting, ML models, ad-hoc analysis, data exploration, etc.
  • Contribute to the proposals on technological platforms and governance model elaborated by the Data Office with its opinion and experience.


What We Are Looking For

  • Academic background: Degree / Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics, Big Data or equivalent experience.
  • You have two years of proven working experience in the data transformation to extract key insights using statistical/analytical concepts.
  • Proven experience in execution and automation of ETL's based on SAS, SQL or others.
  • Knowledge of Phyton, Dataiku and Dremio.
  • You are engaged in day-to-day activities.
  • You have a transformation mindset, looking for the excellency.
  • You are a Problem-Solving and Decision-Making person, who:
  • Demonstrates advanced analytical and diagnostic skills dealing with issues that are ambiguous, lack known precedent or appear contradictory.
  • Sees the big picture and is fully aware of technology and business directions.
  • Has department, corporate and group objectives in focus while identifying and removing barriers.


Skills

  • Communication skills - Oral & Written.
  • Ability to collaborate/Teamwork.
  • Proactivity.
  • Organized, efficient, and able to meet deadlines.
  • Gives and welcomes feedback. Puts success of the business and team above own interest.
  • Experience in the Finance sector is a plus.
  • Management of the MS Office package (Excel, Power Point, SharePoint, One Note knowledge).
  • Management of visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI.
  • Fluent level of English and Spanish is a must. Any other European language is nice to have.


About Our Culture

We are proud to create, maintain and develop business solutions for BNP Paribas Group entities around the world, while keeping a high level of service and providing added value to our customers.

Working in an Inclusive and Multicultural environment, we encourage everyone to develop their talents and skills, offering various career opportunities and internal mobility programs, within local SET teams or in other entities within the Group.

We value our employees' experience by keeping a well-balanced environment with flexibility regarding the work schedule and care for everyone's personal time.

We embraced a hybrid way of working because we believe social connection always adds value to our day-to-day activities.

Benefits

  • Training programs, career plans and internal mobility opportunities, national and international thanks to our presence in different countries.
  • Diversity and Inclusion Committee that ensures an inclusive work environment. In recent years, several employee communities have been created to organize diversity and inclusion awareness actions (PRIDE, We Generations and MixCity).
  • Corporate volunteering program (1 Million Hours 2 Help) in which employees can dedicate time out of their working hours to volunteer activities.
  • Flexible compensation plan.
  • Hybrid telecommuting model (50%).
  • 31 vacation days.


Diversity and inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Group in Spain is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Title: Research & Insight Analysts
Description:
Research & Insight Analysts are expected to independently manage research projects in their entirety (research design, setup, workflow, resources, delivery), assigning specific tasks to the executive line and ensuring the quality of work. These will also play an advisory role (both with clients and We Are Social teams), recommending the most suitable research solutions.

They are also expected to carry out executive work without supervision. These are expected to be thoroughly independent throughout their tasks, with their outputs ideally requiring only minor revision. These are also expected to be proactive and solution-oriented.

Requirements

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


Setup the most suitable methodology and research structure according to specific needs / contexts.
Keep up to date with developments and changes on platform-specific metrics / data.
Master the use analytical tools (e.g. listening/performance tools / DBs etc.)
Present and effectively explain findings to specific audiences / stakeholders.
Develop compelling storytelling.
Communicate with clients and teams at different levels.
Support agency wide pitches and upsell large opportunities;
Able to setup and guide ongoing and campaign reports;
Able to understand different projects will require different research approaches and methodologies to get to the best results;
Able to adapt ways of working and methodologies for different projects to get to the best results and drive growth for the team;
Constantly keeps up to date with latest technology, methodology, creative best practices, clients' and industries' news, applying the findings to agency, client and industry problems, coming up with solutions
Expert knowledge and understanding of social and platforms;
Finds interesting and new industry trends that can be applied to our work or clients. Shares the content and explains why this is applicable to the agency / client;
Brings an effectiveness specialism to the team linked specifically social, brand and commercial data. A specialist should be able to develop complex measurement frameworks and is likely to have traditional quant research methodology training - surveys, data analysis, econometrics. Should be able model out results and create a test and learn culture in the agency and in clients;
Recommend approaches for sharing knowledge in the organization and encourage team members to contribute sharing best practices;
Able to understand clients' needs and able to confidently present effectiveness results (grounded in insights linked specific actions the client can immediately take and in the long term) based on client activities;



Benefits

Who are we?

We are a global creative agency guided by a social approach. We have a team of over 1200 specialists in 20 offices around the world with a common purpose: to connect people and brands in a meaningful way.

We believe in people above platforms, and in the power of social insight to generate value for our clients. That's our approach, we call it Social Thinking.

We work with many of the world's largest brands, including adidas, Netflix, Samsung, Lavazza, and Google on global, regional, and local projects.

What do we offer?


Permanent contract Flexible and dynamic work environment
Hybrid work format, combining the best of both worlds (in-person and remote)
Monthly restaurant vouchers
Monthly allowance to offset remote working expenses
Access to a wide network of gyms and therapy services through Welhub (Gympass), calm and other benefits.
Continuous and on-demand training, Inspiring Sessions, english classes and growth opportunities within the agency
22 vacation days, plus additional days: 3 during Easter, 3-4 at Christmas, and your birthday
Work From Everywhere: Work from wherever you want in July, August, Easter, and Christmas
Full Time Recovery System (overtime hours = rest hours, 100% recovery)
We Are Social Passport (work up to 3 weeks a year from any of our offices in Europe) Lots of laughs and the occasional party
