Req ID: 42408

Title: Marketing & Sales Data Analyst
Description:
‚ö°Do you dare to lead the digital transformation to create a more sustainable world? üå≥




At Schneider Electric, we are the leading digital partner in sustainability and efficiency for businesses, communities, and individuals. Our goal is for all people to be able to make the most of our energy and resources through the integration of processes, software, Big Data, and energy technologies that enable integrated management of buildings, industries, and cities. We are present in over 110 countries with a diverse and disruptive team of over 150,000 people. If you are seeking an opportunity to propel your career and challenge your creativity, we want to meet you!




We are currently seeking for a Marketing & Sales Data Analyst to our new Sales & Marketing Insights & Analytics team. You will be working for the Nordic Baltic Zone and based in our office in Barcelona, Spain.




In this role you will be joining us on our exciting journey towards a more sustainable future. You will be responsible for interpreting data and turning it into insights to provide our commercial organization with in-depth analytics and actionable recommendations to drive our commercial performance forward as we aim to be the best performing Sales & Marketing organization in our industry. You are eager to understand and learn about the business and commercial organization and you animate the Nordic Baltic Sales & Marketing organization with analytics, insights and actions within fields such as Marketing Campaign Performance, Digital Marketing Performance and Digital Product Experience Performance.




What will you do?

You will be working in a newly established team of minimum five Marketing Business Analysts working together with Marketeers, Channel Mangers, Offer Managers, Business developers and other colleagues both locally but also globally. You will play a critical role in supporting business decision making processes by providing insightful analysis and financial evaluations. Your outputs will be critical in order to help the business make decisions, support strategies and to optimize profitability and this position will involve a wide blend of commercial data analysis, financial modelling and market research.

Responsibilities include:

Business Interpretation

Acting as a critical link between the data delivered by the technical teams and the data consumed by the business to support the business to be able to make data driven decisions to enhance go-to-market performance

Data Analysis

Gathering and structuring information from various sources
Making recommendations about the methods and ways in which we obtain and analyze data to improve quality and efficiency of data systems, dashboards etc.
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets and analyze results

Result Analysis

Working alongside teams within the business including management team to establish business needs
Collecting and interpreting data to improve our commercial processes
Reporting the results back to the relevant members of the business
Designing Data for dashboards serving business needs




What qualifications will make you successful for this role?

We believe you enjoy having a constant focus on both quality and performance excellence. You thrive in a changing environment, you are curious, willing to learn and not afraid to ask questions. As you work closely with internal and external colleagues from across Schneider‚Äôs global organization it is essential that you have the intercultural curiosity it takes to build relationships across borders. We are looking for a person with:




+2 years of experience supporting multinational and multicultural work environments across Europe in using data science techniques to generate valuable insights and analytics to support the company's partner performance and commercial efforts
A dynamic individual & role model that inspires & influences our stakeholders in equal measure and has strong analytical and problem-solving skills
A relevant degree such as Masters degree in Finance, Economics, Business Administration, Marketing, Data Science or equivalent
Effective communicator capable of interaction with different stakeholders including senior management
Fluent in English. Fluency in one or more of the Nordic languages would be a plus.




As a Data Analyst you should be experienced in:

Project management
Data models and reporting packages
Collecting and analyzing large dataset from various sources
Analyzing results and identifying patterns and trends in data sets like Sales and Opportunities pipelines, customer segmentation and engagement data etc.
Creating data visualizations and reports to effectively communicate findings
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to establish business needs and develop new data collection and analysis processes
Maintaining and ensuring the accuracy and integrity of data incl. data cleaning and data preparation
Staying up-to-date with industry trends and developments to continuously improve data analysis methods
Understanding of partner relationship dynamics and financial modeling expertise
Knowledge of e-commerce platforms and analytics
Data analysis tools and software like Excel, Tableau, SEMrush, Google Analytics, ContentSquare, SimilarWeb etc.




While also having:

Attention to detail
‚ÄúCan-do‚Äù and positive attitude to challenges and opportunities
Ability to prioritize and execute tasks efficiently under pressure
The ability to make data-driven decisions and visualize them in an easily understandable way
A strong verbal and written communication skills
An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
Effective teamwork and collaboration skills




Our benefits:

To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits and so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about.

We seek out and reward people for putting the customer first, being disruptive to the status quo, embracing different perspectives, continuously learning, and acting like owners. We want our employees to reflect the diversity of the communities in which we operate.

Schneider Electric is an equal opportunities employer. We welcome people as they are, creating an inclusive culture where all forms of diversity are seen as a real value for the company. We‚Äôre looking for people with a passion for success ‚Äî on the job and beyond.




Why us?

At Schneider Electric we're committed to creating a workplace that gives you not just a job but a meaningful purpose in joining our mission to bring energy and efficiency to enable life, progress and sustainability for all.

We believe in empowering our team members to reach their full potential, fostering a sense of ownership in their work.

We embrace inclusion as a fundamental value, ensuring that every voice is heard and valued. We value differences, and welcome people from all walks of life. We believe in equal opportunities for everyone, everywhere.

If you want to be part of a company where your contributions truly matter, where you are empowered to make a difference and where inclusivity is valued, we would love to hear from you.

Discover your Meaningful, Inclusive and Empowered career at Schneider Electric.

‚Ç¨34.2bn global revenue

+12% organic growth

135 000+ employees in 100+ countries

#1 on the Global 100 World‚Äôs most sustainable corporations

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled

At Schneider Electric, we are the leading digital partner in sustainability and efficiency for businesses, communities, and individuals.   • Understanding of partner relationship dynamics and financial modeling expertise
  • Knowledge of e-commerce platforms and analytics
  • Data analysis tools and software like Excel, Tableau, SEMrush, Google Analytics, ContentSquare, SimilarWeb etc.


While also having:

  • Attention to detail
  • ‚ÄúCan-do‚Äù and positive attitude to challenges and opportunities
  • Ability to prioritize and execute tasks efficiently under pressure
  • The ability to make data-driven decisions and visualize them in an easily understandable way
  • A strong verbal and written communication skills
  • An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving

To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits and so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Stuart is a sustainable üå± last-mile logistics company that connects retailers and e-merchants to a fleet of geolocalised couriers across several countries in Europe.

Our Mission üöÄ

We are an impact-driven company that aims to build the future of logistics for a more sustainable world: shared, efficient and reliable. We are committed to creating a new standard for urban deliveries that meet today‚Äôs environmental and social challenges while offering a premium delivery experience blending speed, flexibility and convenience.

Our motto: ‚ÄúMake every delivery a moment all of us can truly celebrate!‚Äù More than 3000+ leading brands already partner with us across Restaurants, Grocery, Retail & Luxury, eCommerce and Professional Services to deliver all types of goods at the tap of a button. Stuart is a highly diverse and inclusive company of 550+ employees with 90+ nationalities working across France üá´üá∑, Italy üáÆüáπ, Poland üáµüá±, Portugal üáµüáπ, Spain üá™üá∏ and the U.K. üá¨üáß

It‚Äôs the right moment and the right place for us to make an impact on millions of people, as home delivery services hit a record high. And guess what? You can help us fulfil our vision üôå

We are currently looking for a Senior Data Analyst who will join our Business Analytics Ecosystems team. Your role will be to use data and analytics to identify and solve the biggest challenges and opportunities for the UK business.

You will be based in Barcelona and will report to Lydia Monnington, Head of Business Analytics, based in London.

What will I be doing? ü§î



Conduct analyses to identify key opportunities for improving customer service and collaborate with stakeholders to implement recommendations
Evaluate financial performance and measure the impact of changes to identify opportunities for improvement
Develop a comprehensive dashboard suite for company leadership to monitor business performance and address issues proactively
Identify and establish metrics for measuring business performance effectively
Build data models to support efficient analytics, adhering to the company's data mesh approach and utilizing shared core datasets and tools such as DBT
Collaborate closely with our legal team to ensure seamless access to essential data resources, fostering efficient operations and compliance





What do we need from you? üòé



4 years of experience in relevant data roles like analytics, product analytics, or similar, you‚Äôve demonstrated your ability to drive business outcomes through data-driven strategies.
Your great communication skills ensure clear transmission of analytical findings to non-technical stakeholders, driving decision-making and actionable insights.
Proficient in SQL, and at least one of the following: DBT, Python, Tableau, Superset, or Geospatial analytics
Proactively engaging with partners across the business, you identify and leverage high-impact analytics opportunities
You display adept problem-framing skills, capable of translating general requests or concepts into actionable analytics plans
Thriving in dynamic scale-up environments, you contribute to shaping the company's growth trajectory through innovative approaches and influence





The stuff you wanna know üòâ



Work in an international, dynamic and passionate environment with a company culture focused on learning and development üéâ
Hybrid working model (3 days/week working from the office) and flexible hours ‚ú®
Ticket Restaurant by Edenred (‚Ç¨11 daily) ü•ó
Stuart Academy with regular workshops, Stu-Classes, and Stu-Talks üéì
Stuart is putting Mental Health Awareness first! Wellness Allowance (‚Ç¨40 monthly) to use in any gym or sport class üßò
Private healthcare provided by Alan üßë‚Äç‚öïÔ∏è
Free monthly Bicing card for non-remote workers üö≤
Volunteering benefit with Alaya: 16h per year allowance to support social and charity initiatives üå±
Parents-friendly environment - Monthly Childcare voucher
Social activities and events (family day, regular community lunch, ceramic class, yoga, gardening class...) üéà
Work-from-Abroad policy (enjoy 30 days per year working from anywhere!) üèû





At Stuart, we believe that employees today want to evolve in collaborative, high-growth environments where they can demonstrate their abilities and thrive both professionally and personally. We are convinced that employees need to find alignment between their inner values and their company‚Äôs culture and mission to unlock their full potential. We work to create a culture of empowerment, continuous learning and growth where everyone can bring expertise, own projects and easily measure their impact üôå

Stuart is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to promoting diversity. We don‚Äôt discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status üíô

Please note: Our Talent Acquisition Team is international coming from across the world üåç We kindly ask you to please submit your CV and application in English so that it can be reviewed correctly (unless the job posting is in a language other than English). Thank you ü§ó

Want to learn more about us? Visit https://stuart.com/about-us/

Title: BI Specialist
Description:
Our Manifesto

At Heura we are food activists, and our mission is to provide a solution that leaves animals out of the equation, while feeding millions of people in a sustainable way. Technology gives us the opportunity to build a food system that not only solves our current challenges but also responds to our values.

We also know that great goals can only be achieved by diverse teams of people with different backgrounds, perspectives, orientations, abilities, food tastes, dress sense, and time zones - we don't just accept our differences; we fully support and celebrate them.

But ultimately, we all have one common goal: accelerating the protein transition.

And that‚Äôs why we are looking for a BI Specialist! To join the Good Rebels team and help us achieve our mission through facilitating informed and strategic decision making through the analysis and visualization of business-relevant data.

Your Challenge


Business Requirements Analysis: Collaborate with different departments to understand their needs and translate them into technical requirements. Identify key areas for improvement and optimization opportunities through data analysis.
Dashboard Design and Development: Create interactive and visually appealing dashboards to facilitate decision-making. Ensure dashboards are intuitive, easy to use, and tailored to end-users. Utilize data visualization tools such as Power BI.
Data Extraction and Transformation: Obtain data from various sources (databases, ERP systems, CRM systems, etc.) and transform it into usable information. Design and maintain ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to ensure data quality and consistency.
Data Analysis: Perform complex data analyses to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies. Generate ad hoc reports to answer specific business questions.
Data Management: Ensure the integrity, accuracy, and security of the data. Implement and maintain an efficient and scalable data model.
User Training and Support: Provide training and support to end-users to help them effectively use the dashboards. Create documentation and user guides for the developed tools and dashboards.
Continuous Improvement: Monitor dashboard performance and make adjustments as needed. Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in BI to continuously improve offered solutions.
Communication and Collaboration: Act as a liaison between the IT department and business areas to ensure alignment of technological and business objectives. Facilitate meetings and presentations to communicate findings and recommend actions based on data analysis.
BI Strategy Development: Contribute to the development and implementation of the company's BI strategy. Ensure BI solutions are aligned with the organization's strategic objectives.
Process Automation: Identify and automate repetitive processes to improve operational efficiency. Implement automatic alerts and notifications based on critical business data.
Power BI ownership: from modelling, data sources, metric calculation, visualizations, service, effective distribution and security access



YOU WILL FEEL COMFORTABLE, ENJOY AND DO GREAT AT THIS ROLE IF YOU HAVE:


A Caring attitude towards our mission and see it as a ‚Äúpersonal‚Äù problem to be solved professionally.
Desire to help, assist and solve people's needs with a GoodVibes attitude.
Passion for the business and a deep understanding of it to make sure your job at this role is aligned to business needs and goals.
Previous experience in similar roles, ideally at an FMCG company or a high-growth startup.
Computer engineering, computer CFGS or similar. Ideal Power BI Certification.
Proficiency with Microsoft Power BI (Desktop application and the Service, and Gateway). Any other similar BI tool such as Tableau, SAS, Qlik, Sisense, Oracle Analytics Cloud, MicroStrategy or Microsoft Excel would be beneficial.
Be familiar with data sources, data warehouses, data models, data quality, data visualization and data security.
Be able to use SQL, Python, R or other programming languages to manipulate and analyze data.
Be aware of the latest trends and innovations in BI, such as cloud computing, artificial intelligence and big data.
Excel skills with Power Query and Data Modelling
Underlying awareness of SQL Server, or any other Database Management systems
Knowledge of SAP solutions
An analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving mindset to approach everyday challenges.
Ability to prioritize and anticipate opportunities
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both English (mandatory) and Spanish.
Ability to create strong and trustful relationships with internal and external stakeholders.



Heura Life Benefits

To make this world a better place is hard work, so we support our Dream Team with:


Culture of freedom, responsibility, and constructive feedback
An entrepreneurial environment that encourages innovation
Regulatory local labour days + 5 extra ones for Vacations! (capped in 30 labour days yearly)
Flexible working environment
Private Health Insurance or Medical Allowance
Organic coffee, tea & plant-based drinks (in local offices)
Discounted gym memberships
Discounts on Heura‚Äôs products
Flexible retribution (in Spain)
After-work gatherings and other cool company events (in local offices)
and‚Ä¶



‚Ä¶ Working with top-talented and amazing Good Rebels! üëáüèΩ

We care deeply, which leads us to have a genuine curiosity to understand the core of challenges and get the right diagnosis in order to recognize what will have the most impact.

We find the best hacker solution to each challenge; if it exists, we go for it, if not, we enjoy creating it. We ensure the structures we build are the most efficient ones: we grow two trees from one seed.

We are also high achievers: we never give up. We are fully focused on generating scalable impact taking end-to-end accountability.

None of this would make sense if we didn‚Äôt enjoy the journey. We smile and celebrate every day because we are passionate about our work and our mission.

HTML:
Our Manifesto

At Heura we are food activists, and our mission is to provide a solution that leaves animals out of the equation, while feeding millions of people in a sustainable way. Technology gives us the opportunity to build a food system that not only solves our current challenges but also responds to our values.

We also know that great goals can only be achieved by diverse teams of people with different backgrounds, perspectives, orientations, abilities, food tastes, dress sense, and time zones - we don't just accept our differences; we fully support and celebrate them.

But ultimately, we all have one common goal: accelerating the protein transition.

And that‚Äôs why we are looking for a BI Specialist! To join the Good Rebels team and help us achieve our mission through facilitating informed and strategic decision making through the analysis and visualization of business-relevant data.

Your Challenge

  • Business Requirements Analysis: Collaborate with different departments to understand their needs and translate them into technical requirements. Identify key areas for improvement and optimization opportunities through data analysis.
  • Dashboard Design and Development: Create interactive and visually appealing dashboards to facilitate decision-making. Ensure dashboards are intuitive, easy to use, and tailored to end-users. Utilize data visualization tools such as Power BI.
  • Data Extraction and Transformation: Obtain data from various sources (databases, ERP systems, CRM systems, etc.) and transform it into usable information. Design and maintain ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to ensure data quality and consistency.
  • Data Analysis: Perform complex data analyses to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies. Generate ad hoc reports to answer specific business questions.
  • Data Management: Ensure the integrity, accuracy, and security of the data. Implement and maintain an efficient and scalable data model.
  • User Training and Support: Provide training and support to end-users to help them effectively use the dashboards. Create documentation and user guides for the developed tools and dashboards.
  • Continuous Improvement: Monitor dashboard performance and make adjustments as needed. Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in BI to continuously improve offered solutions.
  • Communication and Collaboration: Act as a liaison between the IT department and business areas to ensure alignment of technological and business objectives. Facilitate meetings and presentations to communicate findings and recommend actions based on data analysis.
  • BI Strategy Development: Contribute to the development and implementation of the company's BI strategy. Ensure BI solutions are aligned with the organization's strategic objectives.
  • Process Automation: Identify and automate repetitive processes to improve operational efficiency. Implement automatic alerts and notifications based on critical business data.
  • Power BI ownership: from modelling, data sources, metric calculation, visualizations, service, effective distribution and security access


YOU WILL FEEL COMFORTABLE, ENJOY AND DO GREAT AT THIS ROLE IF YOU HAVE:

  • A Caring attitude towards our mission and see it as a ‚Äúpersonal‚Äù problem to be solved professionally.
  • Desire to help, assist and solve people's needs with a GoodVibes attitude.
  • Passion for the business and a deep understanding of it to make sure your job at this role is aligned to business needs and goals.
  • Previous experience in similar roles, ideally at an FMCG company or a high-growth startup.
  • Computer engineering, computer CFGS or similar. Ideal Power BI Certification.
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Power BI (Desktop application and the Service, and Gateway). Any other similar BI tool such as Tableau, SAS, Qlik, Sisense, Oracle Analytics Cloud, MicroStrategy or Microsoft Excel would be beneficial.
  • Be familiar with data sources, data warehouses, data models, data quality, data visualization and data security.
  • Be able to use SQL, Python, R or other programming languages to manipulate and analyze data.
  • Be aware of the latest trends and innovations in BI, such as cloud computing, artificial intelligence and big data.
  • Excel skills with Power Query and Data Modelling
  • Underlying awareness of SQL Server, or any other Database Management systems
  • Knowledge of SAP solutions
  • An analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving mindset to approach everyday challenges.
  • Ability to prioritize and anticipate opportunities
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both English (mandatory) and Spanish.
  • Ability to create strong and trustful relationships with internal and external stakeholders.


Heura Life Benefits

To make this world a better place is hard work, so we support our Dream Team with:

  • Culture of freedom, responsibility, and constructive feedback
  • An entrepreneurial environment that encourages innovation
  • Regulatory local labour days + 5 extra ones for Vacations! (capped in 30 labour days yearly)
  • Flexible working environment
  • Private Health Insurance or Medical Allowance
  • Organic coffee, tea & plant-based drinks (in local offices)
  • Discounted gym memberships
  • Discounts on Heura‚Äôs products
  • Flexible retribution (in Spain)
  • After-work gatherings and other cool company events (in local offices)
  • and‚Ä¶

Title: Data Analyst, Retail Media
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Retail Media EMEA Analytics team, part of the rapidly expanding Criteo Retail Media business, leverages our grand set of shopper data to design and develop actionable insights for our Retailer and Brand clients. We bring the analytical perspective onto the business and provide recommendations based on high quality data analysis and strong understanding of our industry and products. We leverage our unique position to provide our commercial teams and clients with visibility into shopper behavior, market trends and product performance that can't be found anywhere else.

Criteo‚Äôs high-growth business model brings both opportunities and challenges. This position requires working with large sets of data and a variety of stakeholders to solve complex business problems by thinking strategically and proposing innovative solutions. The ideal candidate functions with minimal oversight and has the ability to learn new concepts quickly.


Mine massive data sets and turn them into understandable and actionable insights
Build scalable analytic solutions using state of the art tools of Criteo analytics stack (Hadoop, Vertica, PySpark‚Ä¶)
Develop innovative analytical approaches to measure Brands & Retailers‚Äô performance from design to presentation of results, leveraging all our expertise in Data Science (statistical thinking, A/B testing, bootstrapping, data visualization‚Ä¶)
Frequently interact with other teams (R&D, product, commercial teams‚Ä¶) and clients to share data-driven recommendations and insights
Develop and maintain deep knowledge of Criteo Retail Media products and technologies as they evolve



Who You Are:

You are passionate about data and want to work with leading edge technologies in online industry:


You have at least 2 years‚Äô experience in Data Science or Data Analytics
Master‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, etc.)
Fluency in the core toolkit of Data Science/Data Analytics: SQL is required, Python is a real asset (master most common data libraries: pandas, numpy‚Ä¶)
Outstanding analytical skills: passion for translating data-speak into relevant, compelling stories
A background in the digital industry or consulting is a plus
You have the combination of technical skills, passion for learning, and the soft skills to work with all personality types in a dynamic environment
You are fluent in English



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Valorable:

Nuestro compromiso en KPMG es promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selecci√≥n, formaci√≥n y promoci√≥n ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminaci√≥n por motivo de g√©nero, edad, discapacidad, orientaci√≥n sexual, identidad o expresi√≥n de g√©nero, religi√≥n, etnia, estado civil o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social. Y es que cada persona tiene un valor √∫nico y especial que aportar a la firma.

Nuestros valores marcan la diferencia. Marca la diferencia, impulsa tu talento.

Title: Data Analyst Trianee
Description:
As a part of the Digital Capabilities team in the Procurement Analytics and Digital Solutions group you will be responsible for continuous improvements in digital capabilities and advanced analytics. You will lead the development of new digital products providing critical insights that help solve business challenges. The successful candidate will lead efforts to improve the chemical data understanding across the organization through improved process, governance, and data management.

Candidates must display a passion for systems, data, operational reporting & advanced analytics. The strong performer can expect further career advancement opportunities with Ecolab and will have the chance to move into other roles within Procurement or the organization, with increasing leadership opportunities. This is an exciting opportunity to advance your career with a stable growing company!

Main Responsibilities


Serve as a liaison among stakeholders to analyse, document, and validate requirements for reporting and changes to business processes.
Develop and maintain data products.
Develop, test, and operationalize new standardized reporting.
Develop and maintain business intelligence dashboards.
Lead automation of processes and analyses.
Train other teams in systems, tools, and processes owned by ADS.
Proactively make recommendations and identify opportunities to solve business problems through new business intelligence reporting.
Interface with IT to specify and implement improvements to our data pipelines.


Basic Qualifications


Interest in an analytical or business intelligence role.
Experience with data visualization and presenting insights to key stakeholders.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Proficient in MS Office suite.
Intermediate SQL skills, or willingness to learn.
Intermediate DAX skills, or willingness to learn.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience designing and building standard reports and dashboards.
History of managing and delivering projects, tasks, and initiatives.
Ability to create, implement, document, and continuously improve processes in a changing environment.
Training or experience in data science areas such as time series analysis, forecasting, classification, and regression analysis.
Experience with data analytics tools such as Python, R, SPSS, MATLAB, Stata, and SAS.
Experience working with global cross-functional teams and demonstrated ability to work well with people from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical expertise.
Microsoft PowerBI experience.
Project management experience.
Experience in the petrochemical industry a plus.
Enrolled in or recently completed degree with emphasis in Chemistry, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or Engineering preferred.


Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Ecolab is committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants and furthering the principles of Equal Opportunity to Employment. Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, and disabled individuals at all levels of the workforce. We will recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement based on individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, Ecolab will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin,‚ÄØcitizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic‚ÄØinformation, marital status, age, or disability.

Title: Healthcare Research & Data Analyst
Description:
#hybrid-Barcelona

We are looking for a Healthcare Researcher & Data Analyst to join our Life Science & Healthcare (Infectious, Niche, Rare Disease) therapy group in Barcelona.

The role comprises three broad functions: 1) market research and insights generation; 2) project management and execution; and 3) client service.

You will contribute Infectious, Niche, Rare Disease therapeutic expertise and translate market research data into high-quality syndicated and custom insights to our global pharmaceutical customers. If you have passion for the dynamic oncology Infectious, Niche and/or Rare disease landscape and are excited about the opportunity to work in the market assessment field within our vibrant Life Sciences & Healthcare (LS&H) group, we would like to hear from you.

About You ‚Äì Experience, Education, Skills, And Accomplishments


PhD in a Life Sciences or related discipline is required, focus on Infectious, Niche, Rare Disease is preferred.
2 years of relevant experience
Knowledge of the Infectious, Niche, Rare Disease field is required; familiarity with clinical drug development, commercialization processes, regulatory hurdles and access is desired.
Ability to interpret data and insights and turn into compelling, quality narratives through a commercial lens is required, with excellent attention to detail.


It would be great if you also had . . .


Keen interest in becoming a therapeutic indication-specific expert.
Excellent project management skills (ability to handle multiple projects/tasks for self and to manage competing priorities to deadlines); shows autonomy with minimal oversight.
Demonstrated ability in problem solving, decision making and using sound judgement aligned with team and company‚Äôs business objectives.
Comfortable in handling large datasets and information from multiple sources; comfort in ambiguity with ability to develop rational evidence-based arguments.
Outstanding communication skills (written, presentation, oral) with ability to communicate clearly, concisely, and objectively in both written and spoken English.
Strong interest in engaging with customers to solve their business needs.
Has a flexible, collaborative approach to work; exudes positivity and ‚Äòcan do‚Äô attitude.


What will you be doing in this role?


Build and apply a strong understanding of disease-specific insights, including the dynamics of oncology Infectious, Niche and/or Rare disease markets, regulatory and commercial aspects of drug development and the wider pharmaceutical industry.
Critically analyze data from multiple sources (e.g., clinical trial data, commercial information, market research data) to evaluate market trends, competitive dynamics, assess opportunities and build forecasts.
Conduct primary market research via interviews and surveys with medical and healthcare experts in the oncology Infecious, Niche, Rare disease field, and secondary market research.
Write and produce high-quality syndicated (and custom) content independently or in collaboration with team members with minimal supervision, adhering to product specifications and timelines.
Communicate concisely and effectively disease-specific insights through multiple formats (e.g., business writing, slide decks, live presentations).
Field customer inquiries and ad hoc requests (internal and external) to high standard, showing strong grasp of complex clinical and commercial issues.
Interact effectively and efficiently with multiple stakeholders across the business (e.g., Commercial, Epidemiology, Support Services).


About The Team


We are an international and diverse team of 12 members (3 US based) with expertise in market research on infectious, niche and rare diseases.
The team culture is dynamic, creative, and supportive ‚Äì excellence, integrity, and care are in our DNA.
A modern culture environment combined with all the financial and stability advantages of working for a large business.


Hours of Work

This is a permanent full-time position at 40 hours a week (35 hours during July and August). The position is hybrid going to our office in Barcelona (next to Sagrada Familia) 2-3 times per week.

Benefits


Active volunteering community, with 40 annual paid hours of volunteering time.
Private Health and Life & Disability insurances.
Tax-free benefits (Ticket Restaurant scheme, kindergarten and transport cards).
Language classes (Catalan, Spanish and English).
Global and dynamic employee base (more than 20 nationalities).
30 working days of vacation.


At Clarivate, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all persons with respect to hiring, compensation, promotion, training, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment. We comply with applicable laws and regulations governing non-discrimination in all locations.

Title: HR Data Analyst (100% remote-friendly within Spain/Poland)
HTML:
Welcome to the good side of tech üëã

You might have heard about us, but with a different name: Doctoralia. It all started 10 years ago, when we asked ourselves: is anyone in healthcare thinking about patients? We jumped in and we empowered patients by giving them access to leave and read reviews about their visit. We then provided doctors with the technology to manage bookings easily and save time, so they could devote themselves to what they always wanted: treating patients. And today is the day in which we ask you: will you join us in the next step of making the healthcare experience more human?

Docplanner at scale

We are leaders in 13 countries so far, and more than 90 million patients trust us every month. Almost 300.000 specialists believe in us and our product, and so do leading venture capital funds such as Point Nine Capital, Goldman Sachs Asset Management and One Peak Partners. And yet, employing over 2.700 people all over the globe, we managed to keep the startup-mindset we started with over 10 years ago.

Job Description

Our primary objective is to assist business in making decisions based on data, with a particular emphasis on producing global reports as the primary and most reliable source of information. A team of 12 experts provides support to various departments, including marketing, sales, customer success, finance, and people experience, for both short-term and long-term projects. Collaborating closely with stakeholders, we strive to develop reports, analyses, models, and recommendations that enable us to gain a deep understanding of how we can enhance the satisfaction of both doctors and patients.

How would you be impacting our mission?

  • Derive facts from data and translate them into actionable insights and recommendations;
  • Support the People Experience (HR) team with identifying opportunities and making intelligent, data-driven decisions. You will execute end-to-end data projects and be the main point of contact for the internal stakeholders;
  • Leverage reporting, data analytics, data quality and visualization to provide insights for routine and ad-hoc operational requests;
  • Co-creating key definitions of KPIs, and ensuring their global alignment.


Qualifications

What will help you thrive?

  • Demonstrable experience in using SQL to derive actionable insights;
  • Have 2+ years of experience in the business/ data/ HR analysis area;
  • Experience in working with business oriented teams, knowing how to adjust their way of explanation to the audience;
  • Experience in data management and visualization (experience in Tableau is a plus);
  • Experience in conducting quantitative and qualitative research; can work with multiple sources of data;
  • Experience in leading and executing end-to-end Data projects;
  • Strong presentation skills, with the ability to influence and engage diverse audiences;
  • Strong written and oral communication skills in English.

Which skills are ‚Äòbonus points‚Äô?

  • Have a degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field;
  • Experience in working in an international team;
  • Can take a step back from the technicalities and examine them through a business lens;
  • Like to see the instant effects of your work;
  • Are careful, diligent, and detail-oriented.


Additional Information

What will you get in return?

Let‚Äôs talk money

  • Flexible remuneration and benefits system via Flexoh, which includes: restaurant card, transportation card, kindergarten, and training tax savings;
  • Share options plan after 6 months of working with us.

True flexibility and work-life balance

  • Remote first in one of our legal entities or hybrid work model in one of our office locations;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • Paid time off according to your location of work;
  • Additional paid holiday on your birthday or work anniversary (you choose what you want to celebrate).

Health comes first

  • Health insurance according to your location of work;
  • Access to iFeel, a technological platform for mental wellness offering online psychological support and counseling.

What does the recruitment process look like?

  • A 30-minute meeting with Sally H√ºtter - Talent Acquisition Partner for International Teams;
  • A 60-minute technical interview with Wiktor Kulikowski - BI Manager and Marta Maziarka - PX Data Analytics
  • Meet our CPO Lucjan Samulowski within two separate 60-minute meetings.
  • A 60-minute business case review with Marta, Lucjan and Wiktor
  • Meet your peers in a casual Coffee Chat

We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you‚Äôre reading, there‚Äôs a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we‚Äôre lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you‚Äôve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other.

‚ÄúWe believe all humans, in all their beautiful diversity, should have equal rights, dignity and respect. Period.‚Äù Mariusz Gralewski, CEO

Title: Data Analyst Intern - Regional Operations (They/He/She)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.


We have an ‚Äò‚Äôoffice-first‚Äô‚Äô culture and we place collaboration at the center of everything we do!
We have a non-vanilla personality and feedback mindset. We don‚Äôt shy away from difficult conversations - we see them as a gift!
We work with high intensity and have fun along the way. We also celebrate the wins (a lot!).
We celebrate diversity in all its forms and foster an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work.


üí™Our career development philosophy.


We are building a talent house of high performing teams and leaders. We invest in people who raise the bar and help others reach their full potential.
We take ownership of our career development. We don‚Äôt believe in linear and predictable career paths - we create the job of our dreams!
We embrace opportunities to move the needle and make an impact beyond our scope.


ü§ùOur commitment to being a force for good.


Our platform is an important economic tool for millions of people (customers, partners, couriers) and we are taking action to amplify our positive impact.
We invest in doing good by dedicating time and resources into social and environmental initiatives.
We have the ambition of being DIB role models across the tech industry. We are creating environments, systems, and processes that provide equal opportunities, break biases, and empower our communities.


We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Glovo is looking for an Data Operations intern to work in our team in Barcelona. Are you passionate, proactive, data-driven and hands-on? Do you want to evolve in one of the fastest growing Start-ups of Europe, building a product that will change people's day-to-day and disrupt the on-demand market.

THE JOURNEY


Analyze data generated by our core operations in order to improve our stakeholder experience (Couriers, Users and Partners);
Come up with data insights to help improve most important KPIs for the whole Country (e.g., Delivery time, Cancellations, efficiency, Cross departmental projects... );
Proactively spot inefficiencies, understand root causes and propose data driven actions;
Process standardization: Improve processes on behalf of Glovers through projects (when necessary)
KPIs tracking: Manage scheduling, attendance and general administration of Info-Sessions while supporting daily operations through operational supervision and analysis of KPIs ‚àô Communicate effectively with the local Operations Manager on customer support processes and operations
Work close with the other departments to monitor any structural process optimization;
Give life to your craziest ideas and have an immediate impact thinking out of the box!


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Bachelor in Engineering, Maths or any technological domain
Passionate about analytics: you enjoy deep diving into problems to find the root cause
Problem-solving skills: no problem is too small or too big
Excel proficiency
Experience in SQL is a must
Professional English
An empathetic, inclusive and curious attitude


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Game Data Analyst
Description:
Ready for your next adventure?

We are Socialpoint, a world-renowned mobile games studio based in sunny Barcelona. Our games are positioned in the top rankings of both iOS and Android, and they are played and loved by millions of fans all over the world. We are proud members of the Take-Two Interactive and Zynga family, and we are on a mission to offer a great gaming experience and bring fun to everyone! We are looking to welcome yet another brilliant Game Data Analyst into our Analytics team, where you will be part of the Two Dots analytics team, work to understand our gamers‚Äô behavior, and work with the game teams to improve the product, drive retention & user conversion. Applying quantitative analysis, data science, statistics & programming, you‚Äôll draw business insights that add real value to Socialpoint . To truly make an impact you‚Äôll need to learn quickly & work well in a fast-paced environment while collaborating closely with analytics & game teams.

What will you do in Socialpoint?


Work with the game development teams to provide insights into user behavior and answer key business questions, turning our vast amount of data into actionable insights and transferable learnings.
Visualize and communicate the results of your analysis to senior stakeholders, making data driven recommendations that support key decisions.
Design and analyze A/B tests and other causal impact analysis to assess the impact of new features and changes.
Continuously educate stakeholders on data literacy and analytics best practices, to ensure they are empowered and autonomous to run analytically correct analysis.
Occasionally participate in advanced analytics projects, teaming up with other game data scientists & analysts to develop data tools and products.


Requirements


2-3 years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value.
A bachelor degree in a quantitative field (e.g Stats, Maths, Physics, Engineering).
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis.
Experience with A/B testing.
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics. Prior experience with bayesian statistics is a plus.
Experienced creating dashboards and visualizing findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau or Looker.
Experienced designing and analyzing randomized experiments.
A fast learner, highly meticulous and proactive individual.
Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win.


What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?


Hybrid working from home/office system. So, what does this mean? All we ask is that you live within commuting distance of our office in Barcelona so you are able to come into the office for important meetings/events.
Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona (if you‚Äôre not already here).
An impressive 25 days annual leave, not including public holidays.
5 additional days annual leave on Christmas.
A very generous ticket-restaurant to restore some life-points.
Private medical insurance for you and your family, to keep your health bar full.
Choose from the latest IOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).
Free language lessons (English, Catalan & Spanish ).
Spotify Premium to add that special soundtrack that every adventure deserves.
Legendary social events & parties to let off some steam.
Players develop‚Ä¶Oops, sorry! People development is key for us: an amazing budget just for you to spend skilling up your abilities & knowledge to achieve real growth opportunities!


Benefits

Coming to work in the Brand new office? Don‚Äôt worry - we have you covered. Check out some of our onsite benefits:


Want to stay in shape? We have state of the art gym facilities so you can level up your build stats.
A massive gaming room equipped with all consoles and games you could ask for.
Book an appointment with our onsite physiotherapist for your aches and pains.
Drop by our onsite hairdressers for a trim (and forget your wallet; it's a Guild perk).
Breakfast and lunch for free and also amazing coffee from our barista


The list just goes on & on... so get your game on & apply now! Please click ‚Äúapply‚Äù to level up and submit your application in English.

Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You‚Äôre welcome on the team no matter where you‚Äôre from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It‚Äôs a trick question ‚Äì mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst, International client.|Power BI, SQL, DAX.


About Our Client

Leading global supplier of technology and services.

Job Description


Maintenance, design, and development of reports in Power BI to provide key information to the business teams.
Maintenance and development of Power Automate flows to optimize internal processes.
Develop and optimize data models to ensure the accuracy and quality of information.
Coordination with the data engineering team to ensure data accuracy and quality.
Work with business teams to understand their reporting and analysis needs and provide effective solutions.
Provide training and support to Power BI users in the company to ensure their proper utilization.


The Successful Applicant


Demonstrable experience as a data analyst with a focus on Power BI, with solid knowledge of DAX, data modeling, and dashboard visualization and design.
Knowledge of SQL and relational databases for efficient data management.
Strong data analysis skills to interpret and effectively communicate results.
Collaborative ability to work in a team, share knowledge, and contribute to achieving common goals.
Autonomy and problem-solving skills to take charge of issues and provide effective solutions.
Education in Engineering, Mathematics, Business Administration/Economics, or related fields.
Fluent in Spanish, fluency in English will be a big plus.
Candidates must be based in Barcelona or Vigo (Pontevedra).


What's on Offer


Career progression
Learning
International environment
Work flexibility


Contact: Jordi Aluma

Quote job ref: JN-082024-6498671

Title: Graduate Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Bring your data analytics and data mining skills to a unique team seeking to understand and shape the future of marketing technology. We are interested in technology adoption patterns, the respect of visitors' data and the use of open source in marketing. We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed.

The role of a Graduate Marketing Data Analyst at Canonical

Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.

The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving growth, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you.

This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.

What your day will look like


Utilise advanced data analytics to grow Canonical's product adoption and market penetration
Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
Design and conduct experiments with data, visualisation and insights into Canonical's target audiences
Collaborate with stakeholder teams (Product Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, RevOps, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem
Put in place and maintain systems to ensure teams across the company have self-service access to data dashboards


What we are looking for in you?


A recent graduate with background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc)
Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings
Excellent writing and communication skills
Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges


What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.

üè†Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!

üìöPersonal learning and development budget of 2,000 USD per annum

üí∞Annual compensation review

üèÜRecognition rewards

üèù Annual holiday leave

üë∂Parental Leave

üßë‚ÄçüíºEmployee Assistance Programme

üß≥Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'

‚úàÔ∏èPriority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Business Insights Analyst
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

We are looking for a world-class analyst to become part of our SEE (Southeastern Europe) Growth team. Are you able to translate data into actionable insights? Are you looking for a challenging experience in the fast and rapidly changing environment helping to build a product that will disrupt the On-demand market? If your answer is YES and you are eager to join a strongly data-driven and results-focused team we are looking forward to meeting you!

THE JOURNEY


Understand business needs of SEE countries under your scope and create insightful analysis helping your team to make the right decisions to boost Glovo presence and orders.
Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base focusing on traffic, conversion and retention rates and leveraging on levers such as pricing, promotions, events, CRM and other marketing levers etc.
Drive projects end-to-end translating business challenges into insights and actions
Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base, step change retention rates and maximize profitability
Take ownership of the reporting of KPIs by creating customized tools and using the available ones
Ensure these tools are scalable and up-to-date
Assist your colleagues in gaining access to the right data, and Communicate and simplify concepts to the audience's needs
Drive clarity and solve ambiguity using data-driven approaches
Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with both our consumer and business products, identify growth opportunities, and execute on projects to drive growth and engagement


What You Will Bring To The Ride


2-3 years of work experience on analytical roles leading analysis and turning insights into actions
Bachelor's degree in Math, Engineering, Business, Stats or Quantitative field
SQL proficiency is mandatory / Python is a plus
Ninja expertise with Excel / Google Sheets is a must
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker or Qlikview
Business acumen and passion for end-to-end project management (from ideation and analysis into implementation).
Hands-on attitude is a must. You‚Äôll have to roll up your sleeves!
Proficiency in English
Strong consumer understanding skills


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

You're an original. So are we.

We're a company of people who like to forge our own path. We invented the blue jean in 1873, and we reinvented khaki pants in 1986. We pioneered labor and environmental guidelines in manufacturing. And we work to build sustainability into everything we do. Our brands stand for freedom and self-expression around the world.

Where we lead, others follow. For more than 160 years, we've used the strength of our brands to lead with our values and make an outsized impact on the world. We employ more than 15,000 people globally to support our great brands: Levi's¬Æ, Dockers¬Æ, Denizen¬Æ, Signature by Levi Strauss & Co.‚Ñ¢ and Beyond Yoga.

About The Job

Levi‚Äôs is looking for a seasoned Analyst and Data Visualization Expert to support the data science and analytics team focused on Direct To Consumer data products. The ideal candidate is a great storyteller and strong technical contributor who has experience solving business problems with data-driven tools. You will be responsible for delivering a suite of analytical products including analyses, dashboards, insights, and recommendations with especial focus on clickstream data. You will collect, analyze, and present data to improve strategic decision making and to track the benefits unlocked by the data products. You should have a high degree of curiosity about the business and the skills to discover impactful insights from data. You should be able to communicate those insights in a way that builds confidence and enables decisions that drive business value.


Conduct analysis to estimate expected value of data products. Measure and track benefits created by data products, and convert them to financial or key KPI metrics
Support business stakeholders and regional data analysts by understanding their needs and providing guidance and support.
Create dashboards to track adoption and business impact of features and data product launched.
Dive deep into complex business problems and provide insights on digital features and AI model performance through hypothesis testing. Partner with cross functional teams on implementation.
Partner with data science, data analytics and product managers on planning, goal setting and prioritization.
Partner with data and engineering teams to improve instrumentation and product/models health reporting, pre/post analysis and business debugging.
Partner with A/B test team to design experiments and post-hoc analysis of results.
Bring data to life through storytelling in a clear and meaningful way to audiences with mixed levels of technical expertise and informing key strategic decisions.
Promote a culture of data driven technical excellence, ownership, collaboration.


About You


3+ years of professional experience analyzing complex data, drawing conclusions, and making recommendations.
3+ years of applied data visualization experience. Tableau and PowerBI as main visualization tools.
3+ years of experience in extracting & manipulating large data sets from various relational databases using SQL (Amazon Redshift, Oracle, Google BigQuery).
Coding skills in at least one statistical or programming language (R or Python preferred) to import, summarize, and analyze data.
Hands on experience working with big data, ideally clickstream data, in big data volume sectors such as ecommerce, gaming, social network etc. ecommerce platforms are a plus.
Ability to translate and present complex analysis in executive summaries. Clear and effective written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills.
Strong problem solving skills.
Bachelor's in economics, Statistics, Data, Data Science and Engineering (Masters is a plus) or equivalent experience.


LOCATION

Barcelona, Spain

FULL TIME/PART TIME

Full time

Current LS&Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.

Title: WS Data Financial Analyst
Description:
Job Summary

WS Finance is searching for a data enthusiast that would join our newly created WS Finance Analytics Team. If you enjoy working with data and want to solve business problems with data-driven methods, this position is for you.

Responsibilities


Performs moderately complex data analyses to determine trends, observe relationships, etc.
Automates routine analyses conducted by finance employees - conducts cost/benefit analysis, applies professional expertise to determine the best method of automation.
Creates data analytics tools that collect and process data from various sources and provide insights through appropriate visuals.
Works independently on moderate scope problems, applying professional expertise, exercising judgment, and resolving various issues.
Helps other team members in larger projects.
Acquires a comprehensive understanding of the organization's financial processes and gains proficient knowledge of the company's operations and business.
Establishes and maintains relationships with finance and business leaders.
Develops conclusions, recommendations, and written reports, contributing proactively through research and data analysis support, and sharing knowledge to foster a knowledge management culture.


Education And Experience Required


Four-year or Graduate Degree in Business Administration, Economics, Finance, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence.
Typically has 2-4 years of work experience, preferably in data analysis related roles.


Knowledge & Skills


Data analysis in Power BI (data modelling, DAX) - moderate experience required
Data analysis in Python pandas - nice to have
Understanding of ML algorithms (classification, regression, etc.) - nice to have
General understanding of finance (Financial Analysis, Financial Statements)


Cross-Org Skills


Effective Communication
Results Orientation
Learning Agility
Digital Fluency
Customer Centricity


How will we help your personal and professional development?


We don‚Äôt label you or your performance we look to help you grow your unique potential
Special annual Finance Days dedicated to innovation in the profession, directly hearing from our Chief Finance Officer and other key executives
Skill Champions Development program lead by passionate team members to help you learn while they learn from you as well
Talent management program and Learn2Lead training workshops to accelerate high-potentials career development
New disruptive technology introductions sessions


We love our work environment. We think you will too:


It‚Äôs a friendly atmosphere with supportive leaders to bring your creativity to max
Work-life balance support including flex-time arrangements and work from home opportunities
Corporate Social Responsibility initiatives to help you make an impact to communities at large


Your Additional Benefits Package


Medical package for you and your closest family
Life insurance package
Wellness program, Multisport card and free coffee, tea, sandwiches and fruit
Special offers from theatres and cinemas
HP employee product and vendors discount program


Impact & Scope

Impacts immediate team and acts as an informed team member providing analysis of information and limited project direction input.

Complexity

Responds to routine issues within established guidelines.

Disclaimer

This job description describes the general nature and level of work performed in this role. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, skills, responsibilities, knowledge, etc. These may be subject to change and additional functions may be assigned as needed by management.
