Title: Operations Data Analyst
Description:
Barcelona Headquarters

Hello! We are Volotea, the airline of the small and mid-sized cities in Europe.


Since our inception in 2012, we have been amongst the fastest-growing low-cost airlines in Europe. We are enthusiastic enablers of direct travel for Europeans who don‚Äôt live in big hubs. We are changing air travel from small and mid-sized cities in Europe, many previously unconnected or underserviced. We aim to connect the people in these cities with their passion for travel, in an enjoyable and increasingly sustainable way.

After over a decade in the skies, we have now flown close to 60 million passengers. Today, we serve over 100 destinations in 18 countries, actively consolidating our position among the top European airlines in the industry.

In recent years, we have raised our travel capacity more than most competitors, increasing our number of aircraft, routes, destinations, employees, and markets. Throughout this journey, our team continues to excel and grow stronger as our services gain recognition amongst an expanding European audience. We are a young, dynamic, and international team that enjoys working together to grow our company during this exciting time in the airline industry.

Our main markets are France, Italy, Spain, and Greece. We have 21 operational bases: Nantes, Bordeaux, Toulouse, Marseille, Strasbourg, Lille, Lourdes, Lyon, and Brest in France; Venice, Verona, Palermo, Cagliari, Olbia, Florence, Bari, and Naples in Italy; Asturias and Bilbao in Spain; Athens in Greece; and Hamburg in Germany.

If you feel inspired by our story and you‚Äôre ready to take off with us, continue reading!


We are hiring an Operations Data Analyst¬†who has experience in interacting with different cultural environments and can work in a challenging high-growth atmosphere.

Are you a skilled, positive, assertive, and sociable individual who enjoys working as part of a multicultural team?¬†

If your answer is yes, apply to come on board and make Volotea your next professional destination.

What you will do:


Evaluate and develop improvement opportunities throughout the company that lead to benefits and generate value for Volotea, with a focus on Fuel.
Contribute to the control and improvement of the main indicators of the Fuel Efficiency and Ops area in general.
To carry out management and continuous improvement of Volotea's processes, controlling the operability of the Fuel Efficiency area and optimising it.
Manage the relationship with external efficiency suppliers, as well as the implementation and continuous improvement of their projects in Volotea.
Liaising with internal stakeholders for reporting of results and presentation of opportunities.
Financial control and projections of the company's fuel consumption, as well as deviations versus budget.

What you will need:


Aeronautical Management, Engineering or Science¬†background.
1-3 years experience working with data analysis.
Experience or knowledge on aviation will also be valued.
Demonstrated abilities in gathering information systematically, grasp complexities, perceive relationships between factors and root cause analysis.
Goal oriented and proactive mindset.
Excellent English written and oral communication skills.

What do we offer:



‚ù§ CULTURE: a thriving, positive, collaborative environment where your voice matters.

üí• IMPACT: a fast-growing company where you tackle every challenge and make things happen.

üåà DIVERSITY: multi-cultural team with a mix of different nationalities and backgrounds.

ü§ù STAY CONNECTED: numerous corporate and social events during the year, including regular company status meetings, team buildings and parties.

‚öñ WORK-LIFE BALANCE: flexible work schedule, hybrid work program, flexible vacation days, unpaid leave options and birthdays off.

üèô CITY CENTER: headquarters located in the lively city center of Barcelona, well connected with public transport, and close to restaurants, services, and shops for your convenience.

üöÄ CAREER DEVELOPMENT: soft-skills training courses, office tools and languages classes to boost your potential.

üßò‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è HEALTH & ENERGY: discounted gym membership options, plus free fresh fruit and coffee in the office.

‚úàÔ∏è TRAVEL WORLDWIDE: exclusive agreements with over 100 airlines to travel worldwide, paying only taxes for you and your family.

üìù FLEXIBLE BENEFIT PLAN: a variety of options to customize your benefits to fit your lifestyle and lower your taxable income.




Learn more about working at Volotea HQ. Watch our colleagues define it in one word.


Volotea is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion and strives to recruit diverse candidates. Our goal is to continuously improve and sustain an inclusive culture by attracting, developing, and engaging the best talent in our industry.

Title: Reporting and Power BI Expert
Description:
Would you like to develop a key role in oneof our newest international projects?

At Allianz, we are undergoing a dynamic transformation of products, processes and IT systems to strengthen our leading position in the insurance market through the fundamental business changes of the digital era. Rapid innovation cycles, enhanced digital service offerings, standardization of transactional platforms and highly automated processes are some of the challenges specifically for IT and the business as a whole.

Join our team and be part of a culture that drives innovation and the well-being of its employees!

What You Can Find At Allianz Technology


Work Life - Balance: We offer flexible working hours so you can start your working day according to your needs. In addition, during the summer and every Friday of the year, you have the option of intensive working hours, which will allow you to enjoy more free time for yourself.
International and Multicultural Environment: We value the diversity and richness that comes from working in an international and multicultural environment. With more than 52 different nationalities represented in our company, we offer our employees the opportunity to collaborate with people from all over the world, enriching the work environment and providing the opportunity to learn and grow in a truly global setting. This diversity allows us to have a broader perspective, foster creativity and innovation, and promote an inclusive work environment where every voice is heard and valued.
Professional Growth Opportunities: We are committed to the professional development of our employees and provide numerous opportunities for growth within the company. We value internal talent and promote internal advancement, offering training programs, mentoring, and skills development that allow our employees to advance in their careers.
Compensation and Benefits Package: It includes a company bonus plan, pension, employee stock program, and multiple employee discounts (details vary by location).


What will make you succeed in this position?


Business experience: A solid background in business, preferably with experience in areas such as strategy, operations, or project management
Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills: The ability to analyze complex business situations, identify opportunities, and build compelling business cases
Project management skills: The proficiency to implement and monitor company's initiatives, ensuring their successful execution across OEs

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
About Our Company

Schneider Electric is the global specialist in energy management and automation. With revenues of ~‚Ç¨25 billion in FY2016, our 144,000+ employees serve customers in over 100 countries, helping them to manage their energy and process in ways that are safe, reliable, efficient and sustainable. From the simplest of switches to complex operational systems, our technology, software and services improve the way our customers manage and automate their operations. Our connected technologies reshape industries, transform cities and enrich lives.

At Schneider Electric, we call this Life Is On.

Who we are?

We are the Data Quality Team, part of the Data and Performance organization. We are leading the effort to improve the maturity of Data at its foundations. We are implementing new approaches, processes and roles to increase overall SE data quality, which means that Data is fit for purpose. quality of data is measured in a safe and cost-effective manner and it is sustainably maintained in its integrity and quality.‚ÄØ

The Data Quality team aim is to deploy across the organization a data quality process which is defined in its key steps as discovery, data profiling, identification of Critical Data Elements and definition of data quality check to assess their status, implementation of the quality control and of reporting based on their results, and issue management.

Major duties and responsibilities

As a Data Quality analyst, you will:


Gathers and structures information about DQ check from various sources
Manage the DQ check portfolio and facilitate its reusability across the data community
Collects and interprets data related to DQ issue management


As Part of the overall Data Quality Team:


Support the Data Quality process deployment as a service, within‚ÄØthe agile development teams, building global re-usable data objects in order to facilitate the completion of the data quality deliverables
Participate in the definition and verification of best practices in the implementation of DQ Checks
Support Data Consumers and technical expert in the execution of DQ Issue Management and collects and interprets data


Qualifications


Engineering Graduate or Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
Experience 5 - 10 years with Quality process or Data management
Experience in reporting packages and in analyzing large datasets
Ability to write comprehensive report
Hands on experience on SQL
Knowledge of architecture and operating models design
Preferred some experience on data catoluging ,AWS, Informatica Cloud and BI tools (tableau).
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Travel up to 15% of time (in normal circumstances)
English fluency


What's in it for me?


Life insurance.
Health insurance
Flexible compensation: ticket restaurant , nursery, training, pension plan etc.
Own your career: Enjoy all the benefits of Open Talent Market, our platform that uses AI to connect you with hundreds of job opportunities, projects and mentors around the world.
Flex@Work: flexible hours, telework, sabbaticals, purchase leave, floating holidays, Global Family Leave Policy.
Recognize and be recognized through our StepUp program.
Club Schneider: discount on products and services throughout Spain.
Wellness: medical service, wellbeing laboratories, activities per workplace, gyms in different sites, etc.
If you like to go to the gym, we have a special agreement with Andjoy Become a Schneider shareholder with our "WESOP" program.
Many more benefits per site ... !


Let us learn about you! Apply today.

DIGDATA24

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.

Why us?

At Schneider Electric we're committed to creating a workplace that gives you not just a job but a meaningful purpose in joining our mission to bring energy and efficiency to enable life, progress and sustainability for all.

We believe in empowering our team members to reach their full potential, fostering a sense of ownership in their work.

We embrace inclusion as a fundamental value, ensuring that every voice is heard and valued. We value differences, and welcome people from all walks of life. We believe in equal opportunities for everyone, everywhere.

If you want to be part of a company where your contributions truly matter, where you are empowered to make a difference and where inclusivity is valued, we would love to hear from you.

We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate and we ‚Äòembrace different‚Äô as one of our core values. Como empresa inclusiva, Veolia est√° comprometida con la diversidad y valora todas las solicitudes sin discriminaci√≥n.

Title: Data Strategy Analyst
Description:
Clarity AI is a global tech company founded in 2017 committed to bringing societal impact to markets. We leverage AI and machine learning technologies to provide investors, governments, companies, and consumers with the right data, methodologies, and tools to make more informed decisions.

We are now a team of more than 300 highly passionate individuals from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading sustainability tech company backed by investors and strategic partners such as SoftBank, BlackRock, and Deutsche B√∂rse, who believe in us and share our goals. We are dedicated to cultivating an exceptional workplace environment. We take pride in our culture, defined by our commitment to being fact-based, diverse, transparent, meritocratic, and flexible.

We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK, and the US this year, so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading! üìöYour work will shape and guide the sustainable decisions of consumers and investors worldwide.







About The Role

We are looking for a Data Analyst that will help us continue enhancing the usage of data for the fact-based decision making processes that Clarity AI has as one of their core values and lead the lifecycle of transforming raw data into structured information üöÄ

The role provides an opportunity to join a dynamic, talented, diverse and young company, as well as be part of the team that leads Data acquisition‚Ä¶one of the foundations of Clarity AI value proposition ü™¥




What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Working as a Data Analyst you will be responsible for:

Gather data from primary and secondary sources, ensuring the upkeep of databases and data systems
Cleanse data and scrutinize reports and outputs to identify and rectify errors
Developing and maintaining data dashboards, charts used to support critical business monitoring
Performing ad-hoc complex data analysis using SQL and Python to support business initiatives
Conveying insights through both reports, dashboards and visual presentations
Collaborating with key stakeholders from the team to determine and rank the needs around forecasting and budget, as well as data collection monitoring and data sources usage
Collaborating with partners across lines of businesses and functions, navigating the organization and figuring out who is needed to get things done and understand data analysis requirements
Influencing key stakeholders through data analysis to establish a strong sense of collaboration towards a shared vision and goals.
Identify opportunities for process enhancements




Location

The role is based in Madrid or Barcelona üåç

Way of Working: Hybrid




What You‚Äôll Need

Mastery in data analysis languages as excel, SQL, Python skills and/or R
Demonstrated experience working with BI Tools (Tableau, Quicksight, PowerBI etc)
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Capable of critically evaluating data to derive meaningful, actionable insights
Highly motivated, independent and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact.
Years of Experience: At least 3 years of experience at a similar position
Educational Background: Degree in Business, Engineering or a quantitative discipline
Self-starter who will thrive in a start-up setting by taking ownership and initiative
Decisive and action-oriented who can get things done, make rapid decisions even when they are short of information, and someone who has high energy and stamina
Highly motivated, independent and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact
Excellent oral and written English communication skills (minimum C1 level-proficient user)







Nice To Have

Experience in a start-up and/or tech company
Business oriented person, with deep attention to details
Adept at report writing and presenting findings
Additional hands-on technical experience an asset (GitHub, APIs, DBT, web-scraping)
A deep understanding of the industry and business operations is a plus




Benefits

Equity Plans - ESOP / Phantom Stock: share our success!
Annual training budget to support your professional growth
Private healthcare cover
Wellness and Fitness cover with Gympass!
Flexible Work Arrangements; We promote work-life balance through flexible schedules and remote work options
Global offices across New York, Madrid, Barcelona, London, Paris, and Abu Dhabi, and access to a global network of co-working spaces




More About Clarity AI ‚≠ê

Clarity AI‚Äôs Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognised by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum as one of the most distinguished leaders under 40.

Clarity AI has received several awards:

The Forrester New Wave - ESG Ratings, Data, and Analytics - Leaders for 2022-2023-2024
Investment Week - Best Sustainable Investment Research & Ratings Provider 2023
Fast Company - Most Innovative Companies 2023
European Commission | EU Seal of Excellence 2020
World Economic Forum - Technology Pioneer 2020
World Economic Forum, Young Global Leader - Rebeca Minguela




Clarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.

Title: Data Analyst - Global Partner Ops Product and Excellence (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

Your Work-life Opportunity

You will join a dynamic and fast-growing operations team. The Partner Ops Product and Excellence department are responsible for ensuring excellence in the performance of the hundreds of thousands of partners that collaborate each day with Glovo. You will be directly responsible for improving the Partners‚Äô experience across their whole journey, making them grow and improve user UX, from the data perspective. The successful candidate must be a self-starter, results-oriented, analytical, and passionate about innovation and entrepreneurship. The role would mean not only providing data and insights to guide the team to make the right decisions but also owning full projects related to the Partners. Ownership and responsibilities will be given to you from day one. Be a part of a team where you will:


Create and manage core data products that are used to execute impact analysis to evaluate our project performance.
Improve current data sources & reporting to make faster decisions.
Ensure data pipelines and development processes operational and efficient.
Work on strategic analysis that will help to detect further opportunities
Understand, deep-dive and have a complete awareness of Glovo‚Äôs partner operations situation at all times. Develop analytical frameworks, analyses, dashboards and models for the whole organization.
Raise product requests to improve partners' UX and scalability. Identify tech feature improvements and give proactive feedback to the Product team.
Execute end-to-end projects at a global level


You Have


1/2 years of experience providing business teams with data for decision-making
Analytical skills: breaking big problems into smaller ones and problem-solving skills, with adaptability to change, is a must
Experience developing in Python and writing complex SQL queries is a must
Experience with reporting tools such as Looker, Tableau, and Google Data Studio is a must
Experience with data engineering-related tools (Airflow, Github, etc) is a plus.
Good communication skills in English (plus Spanish as a bonus)
Great team player and organizational skills
Experience in managing projects is a plus
International studies or experience is a plus


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Power BI Specialist
Description:
Are you passsionate about the world of data and whant to develop your expertise in an international and modern team? Then this opportunity is for you!

At Allianz, we are undergoing a dynamic transformation of products, processes and IT systems to strengthen our leading position in the insurance market through the fundamental business changes of the digital era. Rapid innovation cycles, enhanced digital service offerings, standardization of transactional platforms and highly automated processes are some of the challenges specifically for IT and the business as a whole.

Join our team and be part of a culture that drives innovation and the well-being of its employees!

What You Can Find At Allianz Technology


Work Life - Balance: We offer flexible working hours so you can start your working day according to your needs. In addition, during the summer and every Friday of the year, you have the option of intensive working hours, which will allow you to enjoy more free time for yourself.
International and Multicultural Environment: We value the diversity and richness that comes from working in an international and multicultural environment. With more than 52 different nationalities represented in our company, we offer our employees the opportunity to collaborate with people from all over the world, enriching the work environment and providing the opportunity to learn and grow in a truly global setting. This diversity allows us to have a broader perspective, foster creativity and innovation, and promote an inclusive work environment where every voice is heard and valued.
Professional Growth Opportunities: We are committed to the professional development of our employees and provide numerous opportunities for growth within the company. We value internal talent and promote internal advancement, offering training programs, mentoring, and skills development that allow our employees to advance in their careers.
Compensation and Benefits Package: It includes a company bonus plan, pension, employee stock program, and multiple employee discounts (details vary by location).


What will make you succeed in this position?


Advanced understanding of data analysis and visualization concepts.
Fundamental knowledge of databases and data structures
Proficiency in creating and manipulating datasets
Understanding of Power BI functionalities such as data modeling, DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) language, and Power Query
Advanced understanding of business intelligence and analytics principles
Ability to create and customize reports and dashboards in power BI
Familiarity with data cleaning and transformation processes
Familiarity with Microsoft Office suite, particularly Excel


Your Mission In The Role Will Be


Dashboard and Report Creation: Design, develop, and maintain business intelligence solutions, especially interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI.
Data Integration: Integrate data from various sources and databases to create a seamless data flow that can be utilized in reports and dashboards assuring accuracy and integrity of data
Collaboration with Stakeholders: Gather requirements and feedback from business users to continuously improve dashboards and reports.
Training and Support: Provide training and assistance to users for generation of ad-hoc reports, documenting the dashboards, reports, and processes.
Models creation: contribute to the development of analytical models to assess the impact of company's initiatives integrated with an easy-to-use reporting environment
Performance Tuning: Optimize dashboards for performance, especially when handling large datasets.


About Allianz Technology

Allianz Technology is the global IT service provider for Allianz and delivers IT solutions that drive the digitalization of the Group. With more than 12,000 employees located in 51 countries around the globe, Allianz Technology works together with other Allianz entities in pioneering the digitalization of the financial services industry.

We oversee the full digitalization spectrum ‚Äì from one of the industry‚Äôs largest IT infrastructure projects that includes data centers, networking and security, to application platforms that span from workplace services to digital interaction. In short, we deliver full-scale, end-to-end IT solutions for Allianz in the digital age.

D&I statement

Allianz Technology is proud to be an equal opportunity employer encouraging diversity in the working environment. We are interested in your strengths and experience. We welcome all applications from all people regardless of gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, ethnicity and cultural background, age, nationality, religion, disability, or philosophy of life.

Join us. Let¬¥s care for tomorrow.

You. IT

Title: Junior Business Planning Analyst and Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Job Description

The IPCS (Industrial Print Customer Success) WW Current Business Management team is a team of young and talented professionals that are responsible for planning, forecasting, and analyzing business plans (long and short term) and provide guidance, based on analysed business trends and directions, for decision making within the above-mentioned business.

We are now looking for a Junior WW Business and Data Analyst to support this team.

Job Role And Responsibilities


In accordance with plan and team guidance, performs/executes data collection and analysis procedures and data insight visualizations for assigned projects.
Collects, records, and analyses data using established protocols and processes; communicates findings to other team members for review and feedback.
Utilize historical data to perform requirements analysis and identify trend lines across several data sources within the organization to support decisions
Apply predictive analysis and tools to forecast and employ business analytics (including an enhanced ability to quantify and qualify data)
Utilize the Business Intelligence analytics database to carry out statistical analysis and ad hoc reporting as required
Assures accuracy, integrity, and compliance of cleansed data.
Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.
Assists in preparation of literature and presentations for peer review, publication, and delivery at industry and scientific events and conferences; creates patent applications and supporting documentation.
Conducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings.


Education And Experience Required


Bachelor's degree in a technical or business discipline or equivalent experience with interest on data management
Work experience is not required, but appropriate internships related to the job content would be a plus.
Excellent English skills, written and spoken


Knowledge And Skills Required

Job Description

The IPCS (Industrial Print Customer Success) WW Current Business Management team is a team of young and talented professionals that are responsible for planning, forecasting, and analyzing business plans (long and short term) and provide guidance, based on analysed business trends and directions, for decision making within the above-mentioned business.

We are now looking for a Junior WW Business and Data Analyst to support this team.

Job Role And Responsibilities

  • In accordance with plan and team guidance, performs/executes data collection and analysis procedures and data insight visualizations for assigned projects.
  • Collects, records, and analyses data using established protocols and processes; communicates findings to other team members for review and feedback.
  • Utilize historical data to perform requirements analysis and identify trend lines across several data sources within the organization to support decisions
  • Apply predictive analysis and tools to forecast and employ business analytics (including an enhanced ability to quantify and qualify data)
  • Utilize the Business Intelligence analytics database to carry out statistical analysis and ad hoc reporting as required
  • Assures accuracy, integrity, and compliance of cleansed data.
  • Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.
  • Assists in preparation of literature and presentations for peer review, publication, and delivery at industry and scientific events and conferences; creates patent applications and supporting documentation.
  • Conducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings.

Education And Experience Required

  • Bachelor's degree in a technical or business discipline or equivalent experience with interest on data management
  • Work experience is not required, but appropriate internships related to the job content would be a plus.
  • Excellent English skills, written and spoken

Knowledge And Skills Required

  • Demonstrated analytical thinking, technical analysis, and data manipulation skills

  • Demonstrated knowledge of Excel, Access, statistical analysis, and financial modeling

Title: Services Data analyst and engineering
Description:
Job Summary


This role is responsible for data collection procedures, including accurate and relevant data for machine learning models, extracting and analyzing data from the primary and secondary database. The role ensures data integrity and compliance by performing data cleansing and data validations. The role performs root-cause analysis and recommends or executes corrective actions when data related system problems occur. The role applies developed subject matter knowledge to solve common and complex business issues within established guidelines and recommends appropriate alternatives.


Responsibilities


Designs and establishes secure and performant data architectures, enhancements, updates, and programming changes for portions and subsystems of data pipelines, repositories or models for structured/unstructured data.
Analyzes design and determines coding, programming, and integration activities required based on general objectives and knowledge of overall architecture of product or solution.
Writes and executes complete testing plans, protocols, and documentation for assigned portion of data system or component; identifies and debugs, and creates solutions for issues with code and integration into data system architecture.
Leads a project team of other data engineers to develop reliable, cost effective and high-quality solutions for assigned data system, model, or component.
Collaborates and communicates with project team regarding project progress and issue resolution.
Analyzes data inaccuracies, identifies opportunities and supports the development of automated solutions to enhance overall quality of the enterprise data.
Identifies problematic areas and conducts research to determine the best course of action to correct the data; identifies, analyzes and interprets trends and patterns in complex datasets.
Works cross-functionally with different departments to assess, define, and develop report deliverables.
Represents the software data engineering team for all phases of larger and more-complex development projects.
Provides guidance and mentoring to less experienced staff members.


Education & Experience Recommended


Four-year or Graduate Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Software Engineering, Statistics/ Mathematics, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence.
Typically has 4-7 years of work experience, preferably in data analytics, data engineering, data modeling, or a related field or an advanced degree with 3-5 years of work experience.


Preferred Certifications


Programming Language/s Certification (SQL, Python, or similar)


Knowledge & Skills


Agile Methodology
Amazon Web Services
Apache Hadoop
Apache Kafka
Apache Spark
Big Data
Computer Science
Data Analysis
Data Engineering
Data Modeling
Data Pipelines
Data Warehousing
Extract Transform Load (ETL)
Java (Programming Language)
Machine Learning
Microsoft Azure
Python (Programming Language)
Scala (Programming Language)
Scalability
SQL (Programming Language)


Cross-Org Skills


Effective Communication
Results Orientation
Learning Agility
Digital Fluency
Customer Centricity


Impact & Scope


Impacts multiple teams and may act as a team or project leader providing direction to team activities and facilitates information validation and team decision making process.


Complexity


Responds to moderately complex issues within established guidelines.


Disclaimer


This job description describes the general nature and level of work performed in this role. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, skills, responsibilities, knowledge, etc. These may be subject to change and additional functions may be assigned as needed by management.

Title: BI Specialist
Description:
For one of our best clients, we are looking for a BI Specialist that has experience working with the Agile methodology, is proactive, a problem solver and a fast learner.

Daily tasks:

Analyze the source of incoming data.
Apply the necessary transformations.
Obtain a Data mart for end users.

Essential requirements:

+3 years experience as a BI Specialist.
Experience and hard knowledge in different BI tools.
Knowledge and experience in Azure Synapse Analytics.
Expert in data modeling or ETL
English and Spanish fluent

Desirable requirements:

Experience in Data visualization.

Interview Process: 1 interview

Conditions:

Start date: September
Contract: Freelance/Contractor (with Huxley).
Location: 100% remote (person located in Barcelona ideally)
Duration: 6 months + extensions.

Please, if you are interested in this opportunity and you think that you match the profile, apply to this advertisement and we will contact you as soon as possible for talking about the rest of the details.

Title: FX Data Analyst (Product)
Description:
At Kantox, we are looking for a FX Data Analyst (Product) to join our amazing Product Strategy team and help us to make our Clients' dashboards shine, build strong business cases together with our Sales team, and create tools to bring innovation and efficiency in the processes üöÄ

Meet the team:

Simon - CPO

Andrea - FX Data Analyst Team Lead

Gabriela - FX Data Analyst

Lucas - Senior Product Owner

Ignacio - Product Owner

Laura - Senior Product Designer

Saagar - Product Designer

Mission:

The FX Data Analyst in Kantox blends product development with data analysis, offering a unique position to learn, which means great growth potential and many future opportunities.

The main goals of the role are:


Act as a Product Owner for our clients' Power BI dashboards. We want ALL our clients to have access to dashboards to track the performance and the value of our automation software. You'll formalise the go-to-market strategy, streamline the process, write specifications for the Data and the PowerBi teams, keep stakeholders in the loop, and coordinate the deployment of standard dashboards to as many clients as possible. By understanding clients' needs in detail, you'll also help shape our product development. Post-launch, you'll lead quality checks, train teams, and track usage metrics to ensure everyone gets the most out of our awesome dashboards
Play a key role in the Commercial Team, supporting in the initial phase the creation of business cases, i.e. providing insightful simulations through the internal tool and ad-hoc analyses. You'll collect and preprocess data from prospects, generate simulations, and deliver key KPIs to assess strategy effectiveness. Once you master the simulations, you'll shift focus to training and supporting the Sales team, empowering them to run simulations independently and assisting with the most complex and stimulating cases
Dive into prospects' FX exposure and trading data to deliver game-changing insights and tools for the Sales cycle. You'll exploit your tech skills into powerful tools, with the Bloomberg terminal as your secret weapon for top-notch analysis



Requirements

Must haves:


Strong academic background in engineering, finance, economics or business administration with a relevant master's degree or similar
Knowledge and interest about trading and/or foreign exchange (FX) products
Proficiency with MS Excel / Google Sheets for data analysis
Basic knowledge of Power BI (or similar) interface and features
Basic SQL queries for data extraction and manipulation
Basic understanding of Python/R syntax and data structures
Proficient in English



Mindset:


Fast learner; you will go through an intensive training program during your onboarding
Tech-appetite!
Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills
Hands-on attitude, very organised and able to meet deadlines



Benefits

What we offer


Competitive salary
Sponsored learning budget
Free private health insurance
Free Spanish, English and French lessons
Relocation package if needed
31 days of annual vacations
Gym discounts and free sports activities
Ticket Restaurant with monthly credit and regular cross-team lunches
Daily fresh fruit and a beautiful office with 360-degree views of Barcelona



Our culture


An environment of innovation, accountability, and constructive feedback
A diverse and multicultural team of over 40 different nationalities
Grow your role and build your career with our learning and development opportunities
A collaborative and inclusive culture of sharing and teamwork. Build connections for life
Hybrid working and flexible hours so you can work when and where you feel best
Some testimonials: "The culture and the people at Kantox make me want to recommend Kantox as a place to work. There is a good balance between learning and growing and support from fellow team members. I feel like the people are very welcoming and make Kantox an easy place to feel at home."



About Kantox

Kantox is a leading fintech company developing sophisticated Currency Management Automation software solutions that help companies to automate their foreign exchange processes and leverage currencies for growth.

We are a 170-person strong team, split between London and Barcelona. So far, we've raised over ‚Ç¨30 million and became profitable in 2018. Thanks to our clients, we continue to grow at a fast pace. Clients in 75 countries have already exchanged more than USD $18 billion with us!

In October 2022, BNP Paribas signed an agreement for the acquisition of Kantox. Kantox will continue to operate as an independent company, now with the experience and market power of BNP Paribas behind it. The acquisition is subject to regulatory approvals and is expected to be completed in the coming months.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

Kantox is deeply committed to diversity, equity and inclusion both in our hiring practices and in our experiences as a Kantox employee.

We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer and encourage all applicants regardless of race, religion, or belief (if any), color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, gender, gender identity, pregnancy and maternity, sexual orientation, age, marital and civil partnership status, or disability status.
Show more

Title: SQL Data Analyst/Developer
Description:
The Key Elements Resource Should Have


SQL Development: Design, develop, and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, and database objects to support reporting and data analysis requirements.
Data Integration: Utilize SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) to design and implement ETL processes for data extraction, transformation, and loading.
Data Analysis: Develop and maintain SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) multidimensional and tabular models to enable complex data analysis and reporting.
Reporting and Visualization: Create and manage Power BI dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights and support business decision-making.
Databricks: Leverage Databricks for big data processing and analytics, integrating it with SQL-based solutions as needed.
Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models and schema designs to support reporting and analytics requirements.
Performance Tuning: Monitor and optimize database performance to ensure efficient data processing and query execution.
Collaboration: Work closely with business users and IT teams to gather requirements, troubleshoot issues, and deliver solutions that meet business needs.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data processes, data models, and reporting solutions.


Skills

Technical Skills:


SQL Server: Proficiency in SQL Server (2008 and above) including T-SQL, SSIS, and SSAS.
Data Modeling: Experience with tabular models and multidimensional cube development in SSAS.
Power BI: Expertise in designing and developing Power BI reports and dashboards.
Databricks: Familiarity with Databricks for big data analytics and integration.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail.
Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Project Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, delivering high-quality results within deadlines


Certifications Needed


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications are a plus.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Who We Are

Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the world‚Äôs largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviours.

We are feeding the world‚Äôs curiosity!

Job Description

The Opportunity

Reporting to the VP of Platform Intelligence, the Data Analyst ‚Äì Platform Intelligence is part of a cross-departmental discipline at Cint that provides insight on how our algorithms influence feasibility, delivery, and financial performance. These insights are used to improve our products to achieve financial targets and ensure our platform is optimized to deliver at full potential.

The incumbent will collaborate closely with Product and Technology stakeholders and will consult with Commercial, Operations and Finance teams to understand, explain, and predict how platform algorithms affect clients and partners.

What You Will Do


Develop a comprehensive, nuanced, and predictive understanding of sample ecosystem dynamics (price elasticity, demand/supply clearing) and their underlying mechanics
With Cint‚Äôs Product Managers and engineers, enhance our products to confidently achieve predicted outcomes and optimize delivery
Provide advisory support to Product Development teams for subjects related to Platform Intelligence and/or insight driven product development
Create deliverables that express ecosystem dynamics simply and effectively to senior-level audiences, such as:
Visualizations of ecosystem metrics and trend analysis
Trend reports that track the impact and effectiveness of yield operations over time
Decision support documents for high-risk changes
Recommendations for development of Supply pipeline for commercial teams
Recommendations for development of Demand pipeline for commercial teams

Qualifications

What We Are Looking For:


Few years of working experience with pricing analytics and marketing or behavioral analytics
Previous experience with online market research methods/products is strongly preferred.
Explaining and defending analytical techniques in front of lay audiences
Experience with SQL and in working with large-scale databases
Experience with statistical computing languages like Python, R (statistical and data manipulation packages)
Experience in creating and maintaining dashboards using reporting or BI tool
Highly accountable self-starter and quick learner who is driven to deliver
Multiculturally competent
Excellent written and verbal communication with the ability to create data stories to drive product innovation
Ability to understand the big picture as well ensure the accuracy of details
Passionate about driving value using data and technology


Additional Information

Our Values

Collaboration is our superpower


We uncover rich perspectives across the world
Success happens together
We deliver across borders.


Innovation is in our blood


We‚Äôre pioneers in our industry
Our curiosity is insatiable
We bring the best ideas to life.


We Do What We Say


We‚Äôre accountable for our work and actions
Excellence comes as standard
We‚Äôre open, honest and kind, always.


We are caring


We learn from each other‚Äôs experiences
Stop and listen; every opinion matters
We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.


More About Cint

In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish ‚Äì the world‚Äôs largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region ‚Äì and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid ‚Äì a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.

Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)

Additional Information

Our Values

Collaboration is our superpower

  • We uncover rich perspectives across the world
  • Success happens together
  • We deliver across borders.

Innovation is in our blood

  • We‚Äôre pioneers in our industry
  • Our curiosity is insatiable
  • We bring the best ideas to life.

We Do What We Say

  • We‚Äôre open, honest and kind, always.

We are caring

  • We learn from each other‚Äôs experiences
  • Stop and listen; every opinion matters
  • We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.

More About Cint

In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish ‚Äì the world‚Äôs largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region ‚Äì and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid ‚Äì a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.

Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)

Title: Data Analyst - 100% Remote
Description:
We are looking for the very Top Talent‚Ä¶and we would be delighted if you were to join our team!

More in details, UST is a multinational company based in North America, certified as a Top Employer and Great Place to Work company with over 35.000 employees all over the world and presence in more than 35 countries. We are leaders on digital technology services, and we provide large-scale technologic solutions to big companies.




What are we looking for

We are looking for Data Analyst who will contribute to a project with one of our global customers.




Your main responsibilities include:

Lead data model analysis initiatives, especially in the context of a data migration.

Must be able to investigate and propose data mapping solutions to fulfil target data models.

Key player on conversations with data Quality, data Owners and data Stewards, as well as Subject Matter Experts

Must be able to support test cycles to clarify doubts and resolve incidences.

Progress reporting to senior management




What are we looking for?

4yrs working experience as a Data Analyst

Experience in analysis and design of data collection systems.

Track record of developing high quality analysis that has resulted in successful data model definitions and migrations.

Maintains internal and external relationships ensuring compliance in all activities.

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.

What can we offer?

23 days of Annual Leave plus the 24th and 31st of December as discretionary days!
Numerous benefits (Health Care Plan, teleworking compensation, Life and Accident Insurances).
Retribuci√≥n Flexible¬¥ Program: (Meals, Kinder Garden, Transport, online English lessons, Health Care Plan‚Ä¶)
Free access to several training platforms
Professional stability and career plans
UST also, compensates referrals from which you could benefit when you refer professionals.
The option to pick between 12 or 14 payments along the year.
Real Work Life Balance measures (flexibility, WFH or remote work policy, compacted hours during summertime‚Ä¶)
UST Club Platform discounts and gym Access discounts




If you would like to know more, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply and we‚Äôll get in touch to fill you in detail. We are waiting for you!

In UST we are committed to equal opportunities in our selection processes and do not discriminate based on race, gender, disability, age, religion, sexual orientation or nationality.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a talented Junior Data Analyst to help us change the world of digital advertising together!




WHO WE ARE

Seedtag is the leading Contextual Advertising Platform. Our proprietary, machine learning-based technology provides human-like understanding of the content in the web, the highest level of brand safety in the industry and unmatched cookieless targeting capabilities.

We engage with the market on both demand and supply side to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.




KEY FIGURES

2014 ¬∑ Founded by two ex-Googlers

2018 ¬∑ 16M total turnover & Internationalization & Getting growth

2021 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 40M‚Ç¨ & +11 countries & +260 Seedtaggers

2022 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 250M‚Ç¨ + expansion into the U.S market




YOUR CHALLENGE

You will propose new analysis to get the most out of our current data and define what additional data will be needed to improve our current Contextual Understanding
Your data visualization skills will be key to grasp the attention of the public and transmit complex information into simple explanations
You will get full ownership of our contextual data to offer insights and communication strategies to our most relevant clients
You will present your results internally and externally, co-creating contextual strategies with big clients (from Nissan to Coca-Cola, Heineken, Tag Heuer, etc.)
You will help us build contextual tools that would allow the democratization of data inside the company: from sales, to marketing, to operations, the different teams should be using contextual data in their day-to-day
Some experience building extract, transform, load (ETL) data pipelines will be needed here.
You will analyze performance of our current Contextual products and actively proposing improvements together with the Product Team
Finally, you will build a strong knowledge of the ecosystem and sector to develop a strong instinct of how to improve our products and positioning. Creativity here will also be a must!
During all these tasks, you will be using the latest technologies developed by our Machine Learning Engineers: amazing NLP and CV models to get the most out of massive amounts of data!




YOU WILL SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE IF

You have a relevant degree in engineering, mathematics, statistics or an analytics related field
You have between 1 and 3 years of work experience in Data Analysis or a related field
You are proficient in SQL and Python: data treatment and data visualizations are a must
You have an analytical mind capable of structuring complex problems into simple, iterative, solutions
You have full proficiency in Spanish and English
You are energetic, proactive and eager to work in a dynamic environment
You are a real team player with good communication and cooperation skills
You have proven ability to work in a fast-paced, informal, dynamic and exigent environment
You like to have fun while working and don‚Äôt take yourself too serious!




It would be a big plus if you

Have previous experience in a startup or have a background in consulting
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders




SEEDTAG PERKS

üöÄ Key moment to join Seedtag in terms of growth and opportunities

üíØ One Seedtag: Work for a month from any of our open offices with travel and stay paid if you‚Äôre a top performer (think of Brazil, NY..., üèñÔ∏è)

‚åõ Flexible schedule to balance work and personal life

üá¨üáß üá™üá∏ üá´üá∑ Optional company-paid English, Spanish and/or French courses

üìö Access to learning opportunities (learning & development budget)

üçª We love what we do, but we also love having fun. We have many team activities you can join and enjoy with your colleagues! A Yearly offsite with all the company, team offsites, and Christmas events.

üèã Gympass




BENEFITS OF WORKING AT SEEDTAG

Growth: International, highly demanding work environment in one of the fastest growing AdTech companies in Europe. We reject "that‚Äôs the way it‚Äôs always been done". In Seedtag you can find an energetic, fresh workplace, multicultural work environment where our members are from different countries in Europe, LATAM, US and so many more!
Impact: The chance to have a direct impact, here you don't work for the sake of working, we all have an impact on seedtag in our own way, rowing in the same direction.
Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a total flexible methodology.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you, you can work from home, the beach or the office. The important thing is to work on your goals.




Are you ready to join the SEEDTAG adventure? Then send us your CV!

  • You have an analytical mind capable of structuring complex problems into simple, iterative, solutions
  • You have full proficiency in Spanish and English
  • You are energetic, proactive and eager to work in a dynamic environment
  • You are a real team player with good communication and cooperation skills
  • You have proven ability to work in a fast-paced, informal, dynamic and exigent environment
  • You like to have fun while working and don‚Äôt take yourself too serious!


It would be a big plus if you

  • Have previous experience in a startup or have a background in consulting
  • Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders

üçª We love what we do, but we also love having fun. We have many team activities you can join and enjoy with your colleagues! A Yearly offsite with all the company, team offsites, and Christmas events.

üèã Gympass


BENEFITS OF WORKING AT SEEDTAG

  • Growth: International, highly demanding work environment in one of the fastest growing AdTech companies in Europe. We reject "that‚Äôs the way it‚Äôs always been done". In Seedtag you can find an energetic, fresh workplace, multicultural work environment where our members are from different countries in Europe, LATAM, US and so many more!
  • Impact: The chance to have a direct impact, here you don't work for the sake of working, we all have an impact on seedtag in our own way, rowing in the same direction.
  • Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a total flexible methodology.
  • Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you, you can work from home, the beach or the office. The important thing is to work on your goals.

Title: Data Analyst - Intern (Remote Internship - Data Analysis)
Description:
Delve into the dynamic world of data analysis with an exclusive internship opportunity offered by Kreativstorm, a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm based in Berlin, Germany. Work remotely with our multinational team and unlock your career aspirations in data analysis!

If you're passionate about data analysis and equipped with problem-solving skills, this internship is perfect for you. Under the guidance of industry experts, you'll tackle diverse data analysis projects, exploring concepts like data visualization, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and data mining. Gain hands-on experience in uncovering insights and informing decisions, all from the comfort of your home.

Internship Overview and Details:

Location: Fully Remote

Schedule: Part-Time Internship

Duration: 3 months with the possibility of permanent employment after the internship period

Requirements

Ideal Candidates:


Students pursuing a degree or recent graduates in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Aspiring data analysts keen on unraveling complex datasets and extracting meaningful insights.
Analytical thinkers adept at translating data into actionable recommendations.
Effective communicators who thrive in collaborative team settings.
Detail-oriented individuals excelling in fast-paced, analytical environments.
Enthusiastic learners committed to honing their skills in data analysis.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, R, SQL) highly valued.
Familiarity with statistical techniques, data visualization, and database management advantageous.
Some initial industry experience is a big plus.


Your Contribution:


Contribute to data collection, cleaning, and analysis processes.
Collaborate with the data analysis team to develop analytical models and insights.
Aid in interpreting data trends and patterns to inform strategic decision-making.
Bring fresh perspectives and innovative solutions to tackle data challenges.
Foster a collaborative team environment focused on excellence in data analysis.
Assist in documenting and presenting analysis results and recommendations.


Benefits

Why Join Us?

Kreativstorm is a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Our team of experienced consultants brings a diverse range of talents and backgrounds, allowing us to provide tailored solutions to businesses of all sizes and industries. As part of the Yes Network Group, LLC, a reputable US holding company, we have access to extensive resources and expertise. Join us and start your journey in data analysis today!

Apply now and pave the way for your future in data analysis!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Smadex is a leading advertising technology company founded in Barcelona in 2011 and sold to American-based and stock-listed Entravision in 2018 (NYSE::EVC). We are a fully transparent platform built with top technology, countless programmatic management features and powerful machine learning algorithms to help advertisers grow their business at scale. We are currently considered one of the top mobile ad-tech companies in the world.

We are looking for a Data Analyst with proven experience in Python,SQL, analytics and knowledge of statistics to join our Data Science Team. Working alongside our Data Engineers, the candidate should be communicative and analytical, in order to answer the complex questions that Product and Campaign performance are facing. For this purpose we use tons of data available to get powerful insights to resolve them, creating effective strategies to help improve the Smadex platform!

The role is based in Barcelona!

Your tasks and responsibilities:


Analyze large, complex data sets containing the behaviour of millions of mobile users and Apps worldwide to address strategic questions
Obtain and Report insights from our Product¬¥s performance (ML, Audiences, Creatives, Supply, etc) in order to make decisions that will impact revenue. Have one¬¥s say!
Develop automated dashboards and processes to ensure data influence decisions at all levels of the company
Working cross-functionally with business and technical teams to support product performance


Skills and requirements:


+2 years of experience as a Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Proven working knowledge of Python, SQL and large data sets, understanding of analytic methodologies for data evaluation
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Engineering or Business
Strong knowledge of basic statistics concepts
Strong analytical skills with the ability to get insights
Outstanding communication and reporting skills
Excellent command of Microsoft Excel (Power Pivot & Power Query)
Excellent communication skills in English both written and spoken are mandatory
Strong experience with SQL for data exploratory analysis
Experience with A/B testing
R, Superset, PowerBI experience is a plus
Knowledge of the ad-tech industry is a plus


Please note that we do NOT provide VISA sponsorship. Candidates without a legal permit to work in Spain won't be considered.

What is in it for you:


Integrate a highly motivated and young team
Great compensation package
Top location at the heart of Barcelona with a rooftop terrace, Barbeque, and a fully stocked fridge
Great work-life balance: work from home (2 days per week), flexible hours
LinkedIn Learning
Learning and training opportunities
Meal vouchers - TicketRestaurant monthly allowance
Monthly gym allowance to use in up to 30 DIR gyms around the city
Monthly TGIF events
Regular team-building events
Fun and friendly work environment with talented marketers and engineers from over 28countries
And more!

  • Realizar extracciones de datos a medida que responden a necesidades puntuales de informaci√≥n.

Buscamos una persona con una buena comunicaci√≥n y buena capacidad de escucha, con atenci√≥n al detalle y orientado al servicio. Alguien proactivo y aut√≥nomo.

  • Herramientas de scripting en herramientas de Business Intelligence (SSAS, DAX, Qlik scripting‚Ä¶)

Title: Data Portfolio Analyst
Description:
ABOUT AXA




Whatever their stage of life, we provide over 108 million customers with the products and services they need to progress. From insurance to personal protection, and savings to wealth management, no matter the need we‚Äôre always there for them. And we‚Äôre always there for our employees. In 50 countries, we work hard to inspire pride and a sense of belonging in our people. To provide opportunities that challenge them, inspire them, and reward them. And to create a culture that‚Äôs open, supportive, and empowering. Because we know that‚Äôs the real secret to success ‚Äì and the best way for us to keep building a better world for both our customers and the talented people who put them first.




Your work environment:




The headquarters of the AXA Group (GIE AXA) brings together our corporate activities. It provides guidance and support to subsidiaries around the world, to ensure the coordination and monitoring of the Group's global strategy, the application of its standards, the consistency of commercial approaches and the sharing of best practices. The headquarters gathers approximately 1000 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (45 nationalities), which makes it a rich and stimulating place to work.




Within the Group, you will join the newly created Global Chief Underwriting Office (GUO) in charge of establishing, enabling, and driving profit and growth through Insurance Product Underwriting Strategy, Portfolio Design and Technical Underwriting Excellence & monitoring in partnership with the AXA Entities, for all lines of Business.




Data is a key part of AXA‚Äôs Strategic Plan ‚ÄúUnlock the Future‚Äù and the transformation of the organization as a Data Driven company. To succeed in this journey, we are looking for our Data Portfolio Analyst.




If you ‚Ä¶

Are a data-driven and a data passionate person,
Driven by value creation through data use and projects,
Eager to learn every day something new and meeting challenges

‚Ä¶this position is made for you!







Your job and daily missions:

P&C Commercial Line Group Underwriting Office is looking for a ‚ÄúData Portfolio Analyst‚Äù to join the Business Performance team. The Data Portfolio Analyst will play a key contributing role in ensuring Data assets meet objectives in terms of Quality, Timeline & Benefits:

Support P&C CL Underwriting teams in their strategic initiatives related to data framework/governance implementation in various P&C business processes: P&C Technical Performance Monitoring, Natural Catastrophes data Management across the Group (NatViews), Energy Transition & Sustainability (e.g. ESG),‚Ä¶
Lead / Participate to transversal projects & use cases related to Data Mesh and Gen AI, and be a Data Governance referent, working closely with Data Owners (Finance, Risk, Underwriting, entities,‚Ä¶) and Data Stewards (Technology & Data teams, Corporate Data Center,‚Ä¶) to answer their questions, provide orientations and ensure data framework is enforced
Perform data cartography and mapping exercises with business teams in order to document the relevant processes, technical storage items (tools) and relevant data to be included in our data governance framework
Collaborate with data transversal stakeholders (Group Risk Management, Group Finance, AXA Group Operations,‚Ä¶) to ensure global alignment on data policy and effective usage by P&C CL operational teams
Master tool capabilities both from an end-user perspective (browsing, search, views‚Ä¶) and from an admin one (import/export data, data quality review, access rights management‚Ä¶)
Promote data culture across Group Underwriting Office and contribute to the improvement of data maturity through diverse communication formats and events







Let‚Äôs talk about you:




Master‚Äôs degree in business or engineering, with a business data orientation
Around 3 to 5 years‚Äô experience as a Data / BI business analyst. Experience in Insurance and/or Consulting would be appreciated.
Knowledge in data projects management, ideally in major and multi-cultural organizations with large-scale data.
Fluency in English, verbal and written
Good data processing/visualization and technical skills, with confirmed knowledge of Excel, SQL, BI tools (e.g. PowerBI & Tableau), Python, R
Computer literate including Microsoft Office Package
Inquisitive mind with compelling analytical thinking skills
Ability to work with team globally located and cross-functionally, with entrepreneurial spirit and ambition to drive change







What we offer




You will join:




A company with an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce, committed to attract, develop, advance, and retain the most diverse talents, while creating an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their full selves to work and can reach their highest potential.
A company with strong values
A company promoting internal mobility and the training of its employees
A company offering many benefits (learn more here: Reward & Benefits | AXA Group)A flexible company, allowing hybrid work, in the office and from home
A responsible company, towards people, including its employees and customers, and towards the planet




As part of your job application, your personal data will be processed by GIE AXA - 23 avenue Matignon 75008 France. For more information about the processing of your personal data, please refer to the candidate information notice (link).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us




We are a multinational food company that conserves the goodness of nature in our products. We carefully select our fruit and vegetables from their origin, maintaining the highest quality and safety throughout the production process.




We pride ourselves in providing consumers with natural, healthy, and nutritious products that have made us a reference in infant and adult nutrition. In addition, the Hero Institute of Infant Nutrition is within the Hero Spain facilities.




Website: www.hero.es




Sector: Food company




Company size: More than 4,000 employees




Headquarters: Lenzburg, Switzerland




Company type: Private company




Categories: Baby food, Healthy Snacks, Natural Spreads, Sauces, Juices and Nectars, Cereal Snacks, Prepared meals




What is our commitment?




We are on a mission to delight consumers by conserving the goodness of nature. The world today is different from what it was 10 years ago, and nothing like it was in 1886 when Hero was founded in Lenzburg, Switzerland. However, our core goals remain the same. We have adapted to change, offering consumers high quality, healthy, natural and sustainable food.




Hero Spain, with its headquarter in Alcantarilla (Murcia), has formed part of this legacy since 1922. We are committed to naturalness in our products, maintaining a firm nutritional commitment and constantly improving thanks to our commitment to continuous innovation and research, to adapt to the needs of consumers, customers, and new market trends.




Team value proposition




Recently, Hero Spain has been certified as a #TopEmployer in 2023 and 2024 üèÜ, an achievement that reflects our ongoing commitment to the well-being and development of our team of talents. This recognition is a testament to the exceptional culture we have cultivated together, positioning us as one of the best companies to work for in Spain. This would not have been possible without the commitment and dedication of every person who is part of the Hero family.




We don't hire top talent so we can tell them what to do. That doesn't make sense. At Hero, we give you the opportunity to make your mark and contribute to something bigger. We‚Äôll give you the tools and skills to do your job and then get out of the way.




Purpose




We are on a mission to conserve what's good in nature. We do so by striving to conduct our business sustainably and striving to do the right thing. Always. Without compromises.




Values

The new values reflect the company today and the company we want to build in the future. Values are at the heart of who we are as people and they guide how we behave.




Create wow

We dare to do things differently, seek to always win with consumers and customers, and endeavor to be forever relevant and vital to our world. It‚Äôs about Curiosity, Innovation and Consumer/Customer Focus.

Everyone Hero

We work together in pursuit of our common mission and strategy, strengthening our local businesses by leveraging the power of the collective. It‚Äôs about Purpose, Performance and Teamwork.

Nourish others

We treat everyone with honesty, care and respect and provide our people, customers and consumers with what they need to thrive. It‚Äôs about Honesty, Empowerment, Respect and Diversity.

Take responsibility

We make good choices today to build a more sustainable business and environment fit for the needs of tomorrow. It‚Äôs about Sustainability, Ownership, Heritage and Quality.




Impact




We value good ideas, so we want the best talent. Our people can make a difference because we give them the freedom to act, to be entrepreneurial, and to make a difference. This is reflected in the responsibilities. Be yourself, be impactful.




Growth




We all win if we grow together. It's about professional and personal growth. The best way to grow as a company is to help you grow as a person, hence the availability of learning and development opportunities.




Meet you future department




The Finance department owns the financial close process and produces financial statements and reports to guide strategic decision-making.




How can you help us?




As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing large datasets to extract valuable insights and generate ideas that drive strategic decision-making within the company. Your ability to understand and use Business Intelligence tools, as well as your experience in the SAP environment, will be essential for success in this role.




Your main responsibilities




Gather and analyze data from multiple sources, including internal databases, SAP systems, and other relevant data sources.
Develop and maintain BI reports and dashboards to provide actionable insights to different departments.
Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement through data analysis.
Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to understand the requirements of different areas and translate them into data analysis solutions.
Maintain and optimize existing BI systems, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
Provide training and support to end users in the use of BI tools and SAP systems.
Participate in continuous improvement projects to drive efficiency and effectiveness of data analysis within the organization.




Academic Background




Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.
Proficiency in Spanish and B2-C1 level of English.
Experience working with SAP systems (preferably SAP HANA) and in Master Data analysis and control.
Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in a business environment.
Proficiency in Business Intelligence tools, with particular value placed on Power BI.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Power Platform, Databases, DAX.




Skills and competences




Strong analytical skills and ability to translate data into meaningful information, as well as representing it in graphical and visual reports.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.
Results-oriented and able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.




Others




Based in Spain




What do we offer you?




(Confidentiality is assured)

During these 100 years we have come a long way, but we want to continue doing so for another 100 years. To do so, we need talented, curious, innovative, collaborative, diverse and responsible people to be part of this great team.




Benefits

Hybrid work
Flexible Schedule and early finish on Fridays, also during summer months
Attractive Compensation & Benefits package
Physiotherapist
Continuous learning and development
Ongoing feedback
Collaborative and challenging multinational environment
Strong values
Matrix organization
Open and transparent culture
Great work environment
Amazing people
and much more!




Would you like to join us?




If you what to know more about Hero, access our web site: www.hero.es

If you want to dive into our commitment to sustainability, access our 2023 Annual Report.

Your ability to understand and use Business Intelligence tools, as well as your experience in the SAP environment, will be essential for success in this role.

  • Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to understand the requirements of different areas and translate them into data analysis solutions.
  • Maintain and optimize existing BI systems, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
  • Provide training and support to end users in the use of BI tools and SAP systems.
  • Participate in continuous improvement projects to drive efficiency and effectiveness of data analysis within the organization.


Academic Background


  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.
  • Proficiency in Spanish and B2-C1 level of English.
  • Experience working with SAP systems (preferably SAP HANA) and in Master Data analysis and control.
  • Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in a business environment.
  • Proficiency in Business Intelligence tools, with particular value placed on Power BI.
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Power Platform, Databases, DAX.

During these 100 years we have come a long way, but we want to continue doing so for another 100 years. To do so, we need talented, curious, innovative, collaborative, diverse and responsible people to be part of this great team.


Benefits

  • Hybrid work
